src: 在正確敲擊所有音符的同時，手部要盡量放鬆，手指也不要有太多不必要的移動。 如此您就可以盡可能地降低疲勞。請記住，不需要像彈鋼琴一樣用力敲擊琴鍵來增加音量。 彈手風琴時，若要增大音量，可更用力或更快速擠壓風箱。
mt: 1. When you strike all the notes correctly, your hands should be relaxed and your fingers should not move unnecessarily. This will help you reduce fatigue. Remember, you do not need to strike the keys as hard as you would on a piano to increase the volume. When you play the accordion, you can increase the volume by pressing the bellows harder or faster. 2. When you play the accordion, you can increase the volume by pressing the bellows harder or faster.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: 將一部電影轉換成 DVD 格式時，最常見的一種問題是畫面溢出。 多數電視節目的製作目的是取悅一般大眾。 因此，你在電視上看到的所有畫面，邊界的上邊、下邊，和側邊都被切掉了。 這麼做是為了確保圖像能蓋滿整個螢幕，這個動作稱為「過掃描」。 問題是，製作 DVD 時，邊緣很可能也會被切掉，如果影片中的字幕太靠近底部，就沒辦法完整顯示。
mt: 1. The most common problem when converting a movie to DVD format is overscan. Most television programs are produced to appeal to the general public. Therefore, all the edges of the picture that you see on television have been cut off. This is done to ensure that the image fills the entire screen, a process called overscan. The problem is that the edges may also be cut off when making a DVD, and if the subtitles are too close to the bottom, they may not be fully displayed.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: 美國的計畫仰仗從三個方向同時發動攻擊。 約翰·卡德瓦爾德 (John Cadwalder) 將軍將對在博登敦 (Bordentown) 的英國駐軍發動牽制攻擊，以封鎖任何支援部隊。 詹姆斯·尤因 (James Ewing) 將軍將用特倫頓渡輪 (Trenton Ferry) 領七百名民兵渡河，佔領阿遜平克溪 (Assunpink Creek) 上的橋，並防止任何敵軍逃脫。 由 2,400 人組成的主要突擊部隊會在特倫頓以北九英里處過河，然後分成兩組，一組由格林帶領，另一組由蘇利文帶領，在破曉前發動進攻。
mt: The plan called for a three-pronged attack. Brigadier General John Cadwalder would attack the British garrison at Bordentown to block any reinforcements. Brigadier General James Ewing would ferry seven hundred militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over Assunpink Creek, and prevent any British escape. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton before dawn and split into two groups, one led by Greene and the other by Sullivan.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: 在 7 月 4 日由國會通過後，一份經國會主席約翰·漢考克 (John Hancock) 和秘書長查爾斯·湯姆森 (Charles Thomson) 簽署的手寫草案被送到幾個街區外的約翰·當列普 (John Dunlap) 印刷坊。 一整夜印出了 150 到 200 份，現稱「當列普單面印刷版」。 該文件由約翰尼克森於 7 月 8 日在獨立廳的庭院內首次公開宣讀。 其中一份在 7 月 6 日寄給喬治·華盛頓 (George Washington)，喬治·華盛頓於 7 月 9 日在紐約向他的部隊宣讀。一份副本在 8 月 10 日抵達倫敦。 人們所知的那 25 份仍存在的當列普單面印刷版是這份文件中留存下來最古老的版本，原始手稿並未留存下來。
mt: On July 4, 1776, a handwritten draft of the Declaration of Independence was signed by John Hancock and Charles Thomson, and sent to John Dunlap's print shop a few blocks away. 150 to 200 copies were printed overnight, now called the Dunlap Broadside.  It was first publicly read by John Nixon on July 8 in the courtyard of Independence Hall.  One copy was sent to George Washington on July 6, and read to his troops in New York on July 9.  A copy reached London on August 10.  Of the 25 surviving Dunlap Broadside copies, the oldest known is the one that remains.
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: 殖民地開拓者看到這樣的佈署，也號招了增援部隊。 支援前鋒的部隊包括新罕布夏州的第一和第三軍團兩百人，由約翰‧斯塔克上校和詹姆斯‧里德上校領導（兩人後來都成為將軍）。 史塔克的人馬佔領了殖民軍據點北端柵欄沿線的位置。 沿著半島西北部流動的神秘河，在退潮時打開了一個缺口，他們利用這個時機迅速建造小石牆，將圍牆延伸到北方河流末端的小沙灘上。 格里德利 (Gridley) 或史塔克 (Stark) 在柵欄前約 100 英尺（30 公尺）處設置一根木樁，並下令在正規軍通過木樁之前，任何人不得開槍。
mt: The settlers saw this deployment and called for reinforcements. The supporting vanguard included two hundred men from the First and Third Brigades of New Hampshire, led by Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the line of the colonial fortifications at the northern end of the peninsula. A mysterious river flowed along the northwest side of the peninsula, and at low tide opened a gap through which they quickly built a small stone wall, extending the wall to the end of the sandbar on the northern side of the river. Gridley or Stark placed a pole 100 feet (30 meters) in front of the palisade and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed the pole.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: 古代中國使用獨特的方式來表示不同的時期；中國的各個階段或掌權的各家族都屬於截然不同的王朝。 而改朝換代之際也是各地分裂動盪的時期。其中最著名的就是漢朝和晉朝之間 60 年的三國時代。 在這些時期中，許多貴族之間為了爭奪王位，進行了激烈的戰爭。 三國是中國古代歷史上最血腥的時代之一，成千上萬的人為爭奪坐上西安宏偉皇宮中的王位，而失去生命。
mt: Ancient China used a unique way to indicate different periods; each dynasty or ruling family was part of a completely different empire. And the time of change of dynasties was also a period of division and turmoil in the country. One of the most famous is the 60-year period between the Han and Jin dynasties. In these periods, many nobles fought fiercely to claim the throne. The Three Kingdoms is one of the most bloody periods in ancient Chinese history, in which thousands of people lost their lives to claim the throne of the magnificent palace in Xi'an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: 螞蟻大軍也在不同階段行軍和築巢。 在游獵階段，行軍蟻會在夜晚行動，白天停下來紮營。 當食物量減少時，殖民地居民進入了一種遊牧階段。在此階段，殖民地居民建築起暫時性的住所，並且每天變換。 這種橫衝直撞的遷徙或行進，每次持續約 17 天。
mt: Ants also march in different stages of their army. In the foraging stage, the marching ants will move at night and stop during the day to camp. When food is scarce, the colony residents enter a nomadic stage. In this stage, the colony residents build temporary homes and move every day. This chaotic migration lasts about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: 許多學者觀察到的生理及行為上的節律，通常高度倚賴生物內生性的週期，及其隨生理時鐘所產生的物質。 不僅是對於外在週期線索做出反應的週期節律，在細菌、真菌、植物與動物等大部分的生物身上都可觀察到。 生理時鐘是自我維持的振盪器，即使沒有外部信號，也會持續自主運行的週期。
mt: Many observed physiological and behavioral rhythms are highly dependent on endogenous cycles and the substances produced by the circadian clock. Not only are external cues responded to by circadian rhythms, they can be observed in most bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. The circadian clock is a self-sustaining oscillator that continues to run autonomously without external signals.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: 族群指的是在特定地理區域中活動的單一特定物種生物個體組成的群體。 當群體內的所有個體在特定表徵方面都一致之時，便稱為單型性。 如果個體某項特徵呈現多種差異，即稱為多態性。
mt: A population is a group of individual organisms of the same species, which live in the same geographical area. When all members of a population have the same trait, the population is said to be monomorphic. If the population has members with different traits, the population is said to be polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: 以自然為主題的旅遊行程會吸引大自然有興趣的人參加，以享受自然景觀，包括野生動植物。 現場活動的例子包含打獵、釣魚、攝影、賞鳥，以及造訪公園與研習生態系統的相關資訊。 例如到婆羅洲參訪、拍攝與瞭解紅毛猩猩。
mt: Nature-themed tours will attract people interested in nature to participate, to enjoy the natural scenery, including wild animals and plants. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and learning about the ecosystem. For example, to visit and photograph the orangutan in Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: 每天早上，一批人開車離開鄉下小鎮前往工作地點，與另一批人擦身而過，他們的出發地正是另一批人的工作目的地。 在這種繁忙的交通往來中，每個人都與這個以私家車為基礎的交通系統有某種程度的連結，也支持了它的存在。 如今科學指出，這樣大規模的碳經濟活動，已讓生物圈脫離過去兩百萬年來支持著人類演進的穩定狀態。
mt: Every morning, a group of people drive out of a small town to their work destinations, passing another group of people who are driving in the opposite direction. In this busy traffic, each person is connected to this car-based transportation system in some way and supports its existence. Today, science points out that this large-scale carbon economy has taken the biosphere out of the stable state that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: 所有物質的基本組成部分之一為原子。 原子是一組非常複雜的結構。根據簡化的波爾模型，其包含在中央的核心，以及環繞核心的電子，與環繞太陽的行星有些類似。見圖表 1.1。 原子核由中子和質子兩種粒子組成。 質子帶有正電荷，中子不帶電荷，電子則具有負電荷。
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: 實際上，現在所有電腦都以操作二進位制編碼組成的訊息為基礎。 二進位數只能有 0 或 1 兩個值之一，這些數字被稱為二進位數位，或電腦術語所稱的位元。
mt: In reality, all computers today are based on messages in binary code. Binary numbers can only have one of two values, either 0 or 1, which are called binary digits or, in computer jargon, bits.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: 部落格也有助於提高學生的寫作能力。雖然學生常以草率馬虎的文法和拼寫開始他們的部落格體驗，但因為有讀者的存在，所以一般可以改變這點。 由於學生通常是最挑剔的讀者，因此部落客作者們會開始努力加強寫作以避免被批評。 撰寫部落格也「迫使學生更加了解周遭的世界」。為了滿足觀眾的興趣，激發學生變得更加聰明有趣（Toto，2004 年）。 寫部落格是一種啟發合作的工具，可以鼓勵學生將學習遠遠延伸到傳統的學校生活之外。 正確使用部落格「可以增強學生分析與批判的能力；學生能透過積極回應網路教材，明確定義自己在他人撰寫的文章脈絡中處於何種位置，也能勾勒出自己對特定議題的觀點（奧拉維斯， 2002 ）。
mt: 1. Blogs can help improve students' writing skills. Although students often begin their blogging experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of readers often changes this. Because students are often the most critical readers, bloggers often work to improve their writing to avoid criticism. Writing a blog "forces students to become more aware of the world around them." To satisfy their audience, students become more intelligent and interesting (Toto, 2004). Using blogs as a tool to inspire collaboration can encourage students to extend their learning far beyond the traditional school day. Using blogs correctly "can enhance students' analytical and critical thinking skills; students can actively respond to online materials, clearly defining their position in the context of others' writings, and sketching out their views on a particular issue (Olivas, 2002)."
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: 非同步交流讓我們有時間反思，思考如何回應他人。 這讓學生得以按照自己的步調學習，並控制教學資訊的呈現速度。 而且時間限制較少，讓工作時間可以更加靈活。（布雷默，1998） 網際網路和全球資訊網的使用，讓學習者無時無刻都能取得資訊。 學生也可以隨時提交問題給老師，並在合理時間內快速得到回覆，不必等到下一次面對面的會談。
mt: Asynchronous communication allows us to reflect and think about how to respond to others. This allows students to learn at their own pace and control the speed of presenting teaching information. And time limits are less, allowing working time to be more flexible. (Brummer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to access information at any time. Students can submit questions to teachers at any time and get a quick response within a reasonable time, without having to wait for the next face-to-face meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: 長期以來，傳統的中世紀城堡激發了人們的想像力，使人想起馬上長槍比武、宴會和亞瑟王時代騎士精神的影像。 就算只是站在千年遺址之處，都能輕易回想起久遠之前戰爭的聲音和氣味，幾乎能聽到鵝卵石地上達達的蹄聲，感受到來自地牢坑裡的恐懼氣息。 但我們的想像是否基於現實？最初建造城堡的原因是什麼？它們是如何設計和建造的？
mt: For centuries, the traditional medieval castle has inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousting tournaments, feasts, and the chivalric spirit of the Arthurian era. Even standing on the site of a thousand-year-old ruin, it is easy to recall the sounds and smells of war from long ago, almost hearing the clatter of hooves on pebbled ground, and feeling the fear emanating from the dungeon pit. But is our imagination based on reality? What was the original reason for building castles? How were they designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: 柯比莫斯洛 (Kirby Muxloe) 城堡在當時極為典型，比較像是加強防守的住家，而非真正的城堡。 它的大玻璃窗和薄牆無法長時間阻擋猛攻。 1480 年代，當黑斯廷斯爵士開始建造這座城堡時，國家當時相對來說和平，只需要抵禦一些四處遊走的小群掠奪者。
mt: Kirby Muxloe Castle was very typical of its time, more like a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glass windows and thin walls could not hold up to a sustained attack. In the 1480s, when Sir William Hastings began building this castle, the country was relatively peaceful, and only needed to fend off some small roving bands of raiders.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: 由於跑步距離從四分之一英里改為半英里，速度的重要性變得越來越低，耐力變成為絕對必要的條件。 當然，一流的跑者，可以在兩分鐘內跑完八百公尺的人，速度一定夠快，但他不論如何一定要培養耐力。 冬天適度的越野長跑，加上強化上身的體操訓練，是為跑季準備的最佳方式。
mt: Because the quarter-mile distance was changed to half-mile, speed became less important and endurance became an absolute necessity. Of course, a top runner can run 800 meters in two minutes, but he must develop endurance no matter what. A moderate cross-country run in the winter, along with strengthening the upper body with gymnastics, is the best way to prepare for the track season.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: 僅攝取適當的營養並無法造就頂尖的成績，但可大幅影響年輕運動員的整體健康。 維持健康的能量平衡、遵守真正有效的飲水習慣，並全面了解補充營養品，都能幫助運動員改進運動成績、提升運動樂趣。
mt: While proper nutrition alone cannot guarantee top performance, it can have a significant impact on the overall health of young athletes. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, following true hydration practices, and fully understanding the use of supplements can help athletes improve their performance and enhance their enjoyment of the sport.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: 中長跑是一種相對花費較少的運動項目，用以參加此項競技所需的裝備極少，但對於這些裝備則存在著許多錯誤觀念。 需要時可購買此類產品，但多數對實質表現影響不大或甚至沒有影響。 即使產品無法提供真正的好處，運動員仍偏好使用某產品。
mt: Middle and long distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport, requiring little equipment, but there are many misconceptions about the equipment needed to participate in the sport. Purchasing these products is optional, but most have little or no effect on performance. Even if the products cannot provide real benefits, athletes still prefer to use certain products.
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: 磁振造影 (MRI) 的基礎是一種稱為核磁共振 (NMR) 的物理現象，該現像是由菲利克斯‧布洛赫（史丹佛大學）和愛德華‧珀塞爾（哈佛大學）在 1930 年代發現的。 共振時，磁場和無線電波會使原子發出微小的無線電信號。 1970 年，研究科學家雷蒙德．達馬迪安醫生發現了使用磁振造影作為醫療診斷工具的原理。 四年後獲得一項專利，這是世界上第一個 MRI 領域的專利。 1977 年，達馬迪安醫生完成建造第一台「全身性」磁振造影掃描儀，他將之稱為「不屈者」。
mt: The basis of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) is a physical phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered by Felix Bloch (Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (Harvard University) in the 1930s. When the magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to emit tiny radio signals, resonance occurs. In 1970, research scientist Raymond Damadian, M.D., discovered the principle of using magnetic resonance imaging as a medical diagnostic tool. Four years later, he received a patent for the world's first MRI field. In 1977, Damadian completed building the first "whole-body" magnetic resonance imaging scanner, which he called "Indomitable."
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: 人類是目前為止最有能力揣摩他人心思的物種。 這意味著我們能夠成功預測其他人類的感知、意圖、信仰、理解和渴望。 這些能力中，能夠了解他人的意圖至關重要。這個能力讓我們得以釐清身體動作可能帶有的含糊意義。 舉例來說，如果您看到某個人正在打破車窗，您可能會假定他正在偷陌生人的車。 如果他是遺失了自己的車鑰匙，並試著強行進入他自己的車子裡，那他應該受到不一樣的審判。
mt: Humans are currently the most capable species at reading the minds of others. This means that we can successfully predict the perceptions, intentions, beliefs, understandings, and desires of other humans. Of these abilities, the ability to understand the intentions of others is particularly important. This ability allows us to disambiguate the ambiguous meanings of bodily actions. For example, if you see someone breaking a car window, you might assume that he is stealing a stranger’s car. If he is trying to break into his own car, which he has lost the keys to, he should be judged differently.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. src: 雖然人工智慧具有很強的科幻內涵，但人工智慧仍形成了電腦科學極重要的一個分支，專門處理機器的行為、學習和智慧型適應。 人工智慧研究的內容之一，是製造出可自動執行需以智慧行為完成任務的機器。 範例包含控制、計畫與排程，回答顧客診斷與問題的能力，以及辨識手寫文字、聲音與人臉。 這些事情發展成為不同的學科，重點在於為現實生活的問題找到解決方式。 AI 系統現在常用於經濟、醫學、工程和軍事等領域，也內建於某些家用電腦和電動遊戲軟體中。
mt: Although artificial intelligence has a strong science fiction connotation, artificial intelligence is an important branch of computer science that deals with the behavior, learning, and intelligent adaptation of machines. One of the contents of artificial intelligence research is to manufacture machines that can automatically perform tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer questions and diagnose problems, and the ability to recognize handwritten text, voices, and faces. These things have developed into different disciplines, focusing on finding solutions to real-life problems. AI systems are now commonly used in economics, medicine, engineering, and the military, and are built into some home computers and video game software.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: 聚斂性思考模式是解決問題的技巧，透過結合不同的想法或領域來找出解決方法。 這種思考模式的焦點在於快速、合邏輯和精確，以及辨別事實、重新應用既有的技術、收集資訊。 這種心態最重要的特點就是只有一個正確答案。只考慮兩種解答，即對或不對。 這種思維方式與特定的科學或標準程序有關。 這類思考模式的人擅邏輯，他們能記住模式、解決問題、進行科學測試。
mt: Convergent thinking is a problem-solving technique that involves combining different ideas or fields to find a solution. This type of thinking focuses on speed, logic, and accuracy, as well as distinguishing facts, reapplying existing technology, and collecting information. The most important feature of this mindset is that there is only one correct answer. Only two answers are considered, either right or wrong. This type of thinking is related to specific science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking are good at logic, they can remember patterns, solve problems, and conduct scientific tests.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: 錄影的運用已為解讀微表情和僅維持幾毫秒的臉部動作帶來重大的發現。 特別是，有人認為可以透過正確解讀微表情，來偵測一個人是否在說謊。 奧利佛‧薩克斯在他的文章〈總統的演講〉中，指出因為腦部受損而無法理解演講內容的人，仍然可以準確感受到演講者的誠意。 他甚至認為，家犬等動物可能都有這種解釋人類行為的能力。
mt: The use of video recordings has brought major discoveries in interpreting microexpressions and facial movements that last only a few milliseconds. In particular, some people believe that microexpressions can be used to detect whether a person is lying. Oliver Sacks, in his article "The President's Speech," points out that people who are unable to understand the content of a speech because of brain damage can still accurately sense the sincerity of the speaker. He even believes that dogs and other animals may have the ability to interpret human behavior.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: 當獲取知識和學習的能力如上所述那樣改變時，獲取知識的基本速率就會跟著改變。 獲得資訊的方式不同。壓力不再存在於個別的回憶中，而變得比較關注在憶起文字的能力。 本質上，文藝復興為知識的學習及傳播方式帶來重大改變。
mt: As the ability to acquire knowledge and learning is changed as described above, the basic rate of acquiring knowledge will change. The way of obtaining information is different. The pressure is no longer in individual memories, but is more focused on the ability to recall the text. In essence, the Renaissance brought about major changes in the way of learning and disseminating knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: 網路結合了大眾與人際溝通這兩種元素。 從使用和滿足的途徑來看，網際網路的鮮明特性開啟了新的境界。 舉例來說，「學習」和「社會化」皆可說是使用網際網路的重要動機（詹姆斯等，1995 年）。 Eighmey and McCord (1998) 論文中調查受眾對網站的反應時，發現「個人參與」及「持續性關係」同樣也是新的動機層面。
mt: 1. The Internet combines the elements of mass communication and interpersonal communication. From the perspective of use and satisfaction, the Internet's distinctive features open up new horizons. For example, "learning" and "socialization" can both be said to be important motives for using the Internet (James et al., 1995). In the Eighmey and McCord (1998) study, the respondents' reactions to the website were found to be the same as the new motive dimension of "personal involvement" and "continuing relationship".
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: 哥德式風格在 10 到 11 世紀間和 14 世紀達到高峰。 起初，衣著受到東方拜占庭文化很大的影響。 然而，由於溝通管道的緩慢，西方的風格可能落後 25 到 30 年。 中世紀末期，西歐開始發展獨特的風格。當時的一大進展，就是十字軍成員開始用釦子固定衣服。
mt: Gothic style reached its peak in the 10th and 11th centuries and again in the 14th century. At first, clothing was influenced by Eastern Byzantine culture. However, because of slow communication, Western styles may have lagged 25 to 30 years. In the late Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own unique style. One major development was the use of buttons to fasten clothing by members of the Crusades.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: 我們可以開始過對環境更友善的生活，我們可以投身環保運動，甚至可以成為社運人士，以盡量減少未來的痛苦。 這在許多狀況下就跟「頭痛醫頭，腳痛醫腳」一樣。不過，如果我們想要的不止是暫時性的解決方案，那麼我們就應該找到問題的根源，然後徹底解決它們。 這世界因為人類科學與技術的進步而有了改變，而且由於人口過剩和人類浪費的生活方式，使得問題變本加厲，這點再明顯不過。
mt: We can start living a more environmentally friendly life, we can join the environmental movement, even become an activist to reduce future suffering as much as possible. In many cases, this is like "headache medicine headache, foot pain medicine foot." However, if we want more than just a temporary solution, we should find the root of the problem and solve it thoroughly. This world has changed because of human science and technology, and because of overpopulation and human wasteful living habits, the problem has become more serious than ever.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: 歐洲國家嘗試維持其國家主權的一種制度稱為權力平衡。 這其中的概念是，所有歐洲國家必須努力預防單一國家壯大，因此各國政府常常改換同盟來維持平衡。 西班牙王位繼承戰爭成為以權力平衡為核心議題的第一場戰爭。 這是一項重大改變，代表歐洲列強不能再以宗教戰爭作為藉口，因此，三十年戰爭成為最後一場宗教戰爭。
mt: The concept of balance of power in Europe is that all European countries must work to prevent any one country from growing too large, so governments often change alliances to maintain the balance. The War of the Spanish Succession was the first war to be fought on the basis of balance of power. This was a major change, meaning that the European powers could no longer use religious wars as an excuse, so the Thirty Years' War was the last religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: 在歐洲歷史的這段時期，已變得富有且強大的天主教教會受到了嚴格的審視。 一千多年來，儘管依然存在語言和習俗的差異，基督教仍讓歐洲各國緊密相連。 其無所不在的能力影響所有人，上至國王，下至平民。 基督教有一條主要信條，亦即財富必須用於幫助受苦與貧窮的人，而教堂的資金就是特別為這種理由設立的。 一千多年來，教會的權力核心都位於羅馬，這種權力與金錢的集中，令許多人質疑教會是否確實遵循這項信條。
mt: In this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, was under strict scrutiny. For over a thousand years, although there were differences in language and custom, Christianity had bound the nations of Europe together. Its omnipresence affected everyone, from kings to peasants. Christianity had one main tenet, that wealth must be used to help the poor and suffering, and the church's money was set aside for this reason. For over a thousand years, the power core of the church was in Rome, and this concentration of power and money caused many to question whether the church was truly following this tenet.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: 飽受驚嚇的國王路易十六、王后瑪麗．安東尼和他們的兩個孩子（11歲的瑪麗泰瑞絲及 4 歲的路易查爾斯）以及國王的妹妹伊莉莎白公主，於 1789 年 10 月 6 日被一群市集婦女逼迫從凡爾賽宮遷回巴黎。 他們搭乘馬車返回巴黎，沿途被一群暴民包圍，民眾對著國王和王后叫囂、口出威脅。 暴民迫使國王和皇后敞開馬車的窗戶。 某刻，一名暴徒成員甚至在驚恐的皇后面前揮舞著王室衛兵的頭顱，該衛兵在在凡爾賽宮被殺。
mt: King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette and their two children (11-year-old Marie Therese and 4-year-old Louis Charles) as well as the king's sister, Princess Elizabeth, were forced to leave Versailles and return to Paris on October 6, 1789. They traveled by carriage back to Paris, where they were surrounded by a mob of rioters. The mob shouted insults and threats at the king and queen. The mob forced the king and queen to open the windows of their carriage. At one point, a rioter even waved the head of a royal guard in front of the terrified queen, who had been killed at Versailles.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: 戰爭爆發後不久，英國便開始對德國發起海上封鎖。 這套切斷必要軍事及民生物資供應的戰略確實奏效，雖然這種封鎖方式已違反過去兩個世紀以來，透過多項國際協議所制定且普遍為各國接受的國際法規。 英國在國際海域布置水雷，以防止任何船隻進入整個海域，甚至危害到中立船隻。 由於各國對此戰術沒什麼反應，德國因此認為他們的無限制潛艇戰也不會招致強烈反彈。
mt: Shortly after the war began, Britain began to impose a naval blockade on Germany. This strategy of cutting off essential military and civilian supplies was certainly effective, although this type of blockade had violated the international law established over the previous two centuries and generally accepted by all nations through a series of international treaties. Britain laid mines in international waters to prevent any ships from entering the entire sea, even endangering neutral ships. Because there was little reaction from other nations, Germany believed that their unrestricted submarine warfare would not provoke a strong reaction.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: 在整個美國約有 400,000 起已知的多發性硬化症 (MS) 案例，使其成為較年輕和中年的成年人的主要神經性疾病。 多發性硬化症是影響腦部、脊髓和視神經等中樞神經系統的病症。 研究發現，女性罹患多發性硬化症的機率比男性高出兩倍。
mt: There are about 400,000 known cases of multiple sclerosis (MS) in the United States, making it the most common neurological disease among young and middle-aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, including the brain, spinal cord and optic nerves. Researchers found that women are twice as likely to develop MS as men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: 研究發現，抑鬱、恐懼感和災難化可以調解下背部疼痛患者疼痛與失能之間的關係。 只有災難性的，而非抑鬱和恐懼的作用，才是需要每週定期結構性身體活動訓練的條件。 那些進行規律活動的人在對於疼痛的負面感知即慢性疼痛及一般物理性動作所造成的不適感之間的區別，需要更多的協助。
mt: The study found that depression, fear and disaster can mediate the relationship between low back pain patients' pain and disability. Only the disaster, not depression and fear, is a condition that requires regular structured physical activity training. Those who exercise regularly need more help in distinguishing between negative perceptions of pain, chronic pain, and general physical activity caused by discomfort.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: 現代運動擊劍具有許多級別。從大學學習的學生，到職業以及奧運競賽都有。 這種運動主要以決鬥模式進行，由一名擊劍選手對決另一名選手。
mt: Modern fencing has many levels. From students learning at the university level, to professionals and Olympic competition, there is a place for everyone. This sport is primarily conducted in a duel format, with one fencer competing against another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: 體內中毒可能不會立即顯現。嘔吐之類症狀過於普遍，無法據之做出直接的診斷。 最好判斷體內中毒的跡象，可能是發現有著已打開的藥物或毒性家用化學物的容器。 檢視該特定毒物標籤上的急救說明。
mt: Poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Vomiting is so common that it can't be used to make a direct diagnosis. The best way to determine poisoning is to find an open container of a drug or household chemical. Check the label of the specific poison for emergency instructions.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: 檢查傷者之前，你必須先觀察周邊環境，確保自己的安全。 靠近傷者時須注意傷者位置和任何出現的警訊。 如果你在試圖幫助時受傷，可能只會讓事態變得更糟。
mt: 1. Check the scene for hazards. 2. Check the patient for danger. 3. Check the patient for responsiveness.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: 革命產生許多社會和政治層面的影響，例如採用公制度量衡、專制主義改為共和主義和民族主義，以及國家屬於人民而非君主獨有的信念。 且在革命之後，各種職缺都開放給所有主動求職的男性，讓最有意願和成就者得以接掌。 同樣的情形也發生在軍隊裡，因為他們此時已不用階級來區分軍階，而是以才幹為基準。 法國大革命也啟發了許多其他國家的受迫勞工階級展開革命。
mt: The revolution had many social and political effects, such as the adoption of the metric system, the change from absolutism to republicanism and nationalism, and the belief that the nation belongs to the people, not the monarch.  After the revolution, all jobs were open to all men who sought them, allowing the most willing and able to take them.  The same was true in the military, where rank was no longer based on class, but on merit.  The French Revolution also inspired many other countries' working classes to revolt.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: 所有人都參與社會活動，使用運輸系統。幾乎每一個人都抱怨運輸系統。 在已開發國家，你極少會聽到類似有關水質和橋樑坍塌的抱怨。 為什麼交通系統會招來這些怨言，為什麼每天都會出問題？是因為交通工程師能力不足？還是有更根本性的原因？
mt: Everyone participates in social activities and uses the transportation system. Almost everyone complains about the transportation system. In developed countries, you rarely hear complaints about water quality and bridges collapsing. Why does the transportation system attract these complaints? Why does it have problems every day? Is it because transportation engineers are not competent enough? Or is there a more fundamental reason?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: 交通流量就是研究兩地之間的個別駕駛和交通工具的移動情況，以及用路人之間的互動關係。 問題是，因為無法百分之百預測駕駛習慣，所以研究交通流量非常困難。 幸運的是，駕駛的行為趨向於合理的一致範圍裡，因此，車流趨向也有合理的一致性，並可用數學方式粗略地表現出來。 為了更加完善地表示交通流量，我們定義了三種主要特徵之間的關係：(1) 流量，(2) 密度，與 (3) 速度。 這些關係有助於交通設施的計畫、設計與運作。
mt: Traffic flow is the study of the individual movements of drivers and vehicles between two locations, as well as the interactions between pedestrians. The problem is that it is difficult to predict driving habits exactly, so studying traffic flow is difficult. Fortunately, drivers' behavior tends to be within a reasonable range of consistency, so traffic flow tends to be within a reasonable range of consistency, and can be roughly represented mathematically. To further represent traffic flow, we define the relationships between three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in planning, designing, and operating traffic facilities.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: 赫雪-蔡司實驗是顯示 DNA 為遺傳物質的主要實驗之一。 赫希 (Hershey) 與蔡斯 (Chase) 利用噬菌體，或稱病毒，將自己的 DNA 植入細菌中。 他們進行了兩項實驗，一個是使用放射性磷標記噬菌體中的 DNA，另一個是使用放射性硫標記噬菌體的蛋白質。
mt: 1 of the key experiments showing DNA as the genetic material was the Hershey-Chase experiment. Hershey and Chase used bacteriophages, or viruses, to insert their DNA into bacteria. They performed 2 experiments, one using radioactive phosphorus to mark the DNA in the bacteriophage, and another using radioactive sulfur to mark the proteins in the bacteriophage.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: 根據突變的種類、受影響遺傳物質的重要性、以及受影響細胞是否為生殖系細胞，突變能有各種不同的效果。 只有生殖細胞系細胞中的突變會遺傳給子女，而其他地方的突變可以導致細胞死亡或癌症。
mt: Mutations can have a variety of effects depending on the type of mutation, the importance of the affected genetic material, and whether the affected cell is a reproductive cell. Only mutations in reproductive cells will be inherited by children, while other mutations can cause cell death or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: 山羊似乎是在一萬年前左右，在伊朗的札格洛斯山脈首次被馴養的。 古文化與部落開始飼養牠們以便取得奶、毛、肉與皮。 馴養山羊一般放養丘陵或其他放牧區域中，通常由兒童或青少年的牧山羊人負責照顧，和較為廣為人知的牧羊人相似。這些放牧方法至今仍然為人所用。
mt: Goats were apparently first domesticated about 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for milk, wool, meat and skin. Domesticated goats are usually grazed on hills or other grazing areas, usually by children or young people of the shepherd, similar to the more widely known shepherds. These grazing methods are still in use today.
ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: 高爾夫球這種運動，是球員用球桿把球打進洞裡。 一場標準比賽是 18 洞，球員一般從球場的第一洞開始，然後在第 18 洞結束。 打完全場後，由以最低桿數，也就是最少揮桿次數進洞的球員贏得比賽。 球賽在草地上進行，球洞周圍的草割得較短，稱為果嶺。
mt: Golf is a sport in which players use a club to hit a ball into a hole. A standard match is 18 holes, and players generally start at the first hole and end at the 18th. The player with the lowest score, or the fewest swings of the club to get the ball into the hole, wins the match. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is cut shorter, called the green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: 科學的主要目標是透過科學方法了解世界運作的方式。這種方法實際上也引領著多數科學研究。 但實驗法並不是唯一，實驗是能消除一個或多個假設的測試，問問題和進行觀察也能夠引領科學研究。
mt: The main goal of science is to understand how the world works. This method also leads most scientific research. But the experimental method is not the only one, the experiment is a test to eliminate one or more hypotheses, asking questions and conducting observations can also lead scientific research.
ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: 龍捲風與其他猛烈的風暴相比，侵襲的範圍較小，但它們能夠摧毀所有它們所經之處的東西。 龍捲風能將樹連根拔起，將建築物上的木板扯掉，並將車輛拋向空中。龍捲風之中最猛烈的 2% 能持續超過 3 小時。 這些怪獸風暴的風速高達每小時 480 公里（每秒 133 公尺；每小時 300 英里）。
mt: Tornadoes, compared to other violent storms, are small in scope but can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes can uproot trees, rip shingles off buildings, and toss cars into the air. The most violent 2 percent of tornadoes can last more than three hours. These monsters can reach speeds of 480 kilometers per hour (133 meters per second; 300 miles per hour).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: 人類幾千年來一直在製造透鏡，並使用它的放大功能。 但第一架真正的望遠鏡是 16 世紀末才在歐洲被製造出來的。 這些望遠鏡使用兩個鏡片，讓遠方的物體顯得更近且更大。
mt: Humans have been making lenses and using their magnifying properties for thousands of years. But the first true telescope was not made in Europe until the late 16th century. These telescopes used two lenses to make distant objects appear closer and larger.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: 穆罕默德對於超脫這個世俗世界的事物深感興趣。他常去「努爾」（光）山上一個叫做「西拉 (Hira)」的洞穴冥想。 洞窟本身歷經時代更迭，呈現出生動的穆罕默德精神面向。 這座山洞位於麥加北方的一座山頂上，徹底與外面的世界隔絕。 實際上，即便有人知道它的存在也不容易找到。一旦進到山洞內，就完全與世隔絕。 除了上方晴朗美麗的天空和周圍群山，其他什麼都看不到；洞穴內部只能看到或聽到一小部分的世界。
mt: Muhammad was interested in the transcendent, the world beyond the mundane. He often went to the cave of Hira on the mountain of Nur (Light) to meditate. The cave has gone through the ages, showing the dynamic Muhammad’s spiritual aspect. This cave is on the top of a mountain north of Mecca, completely cut off from the outside world. In fact, even if someone knew it existed, it would be hard to find. Once inside the cave, one is completely cut off from the world. Except for the beautiful sky above and the surrounding mountains, nothing else can be seen; inside the cave, one can only see or hear a small part of the world.
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: 英格蘭早在十六世紀就建造了馬拉軌道。 雖然四輪貨運軌道僅由平行木板條組成，卻能讓馬匹在軌道上拖拉貨物，相較於當時稍微崎嶇的路面，運送速度更快且能裝載更多貨物。 很早就開始採用軌枕將軌道固定住。但漸漸地，人們發現若鋪上鐵條，軌道效率較高。 這成為常見作法，但鐵會使馬車的木輪上出現更多磨損。 最後，鐵輪取代了木輪。1767年，第一條全鐵的鐵道問世。
mt: England built the first tramway in the 16th century. Although the four-wheeled freight tramway was only made up of parallel wooden boards, it could pull goods on the tramway faster than the slightly bumpy road at the time and could carry more goods. The tramway was gradually fixed by using the track bed. However, people gradually found that if the track was paved with iron, the efficiency of the tramway was higher. This became a common practice, but iron would cause more wear on the wooden wheels of the horse-drawn carriages. Finally, iron wheels replaced wooden wheels. The first all-iron railway was born in 1767.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.

src: 文化決定論是浪漫主義的重要構成之一，多取材自歌德、費希特和施萊格爾等作家。 在浪漫主義的脈絡中，地理環境塑造了個體，且隨著時間的推移產生出與該地理環境相關的習俗和文化。這些習俗和文化由於與當地社會和諧一致，所以比武斷地實施的法律更好。
mt: Cultural determinism is an important component of Romanticism, and is based on the works of authors such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, geography shapes the individual, and over time produces customs and cultures related to that geography. These customs and cultures are harmonious with the local society, and are better than laws that are imposed arbitrarily.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: 科技決定論這個詞彙涵蓋了許多已實踐的概念，從技術推動或科技主導型變革，一直到較嚴謹「科學定律與科學在科技中的表現形式背後的相關邏輯會推動人類命運」。 多數對於科技決定論的詮釋都有兩個主要理念：科技本身的發展途徑遠比文化或政治因素有著更大之影響力，以及科技反過來會「影響」社會固有型態，而非受社會制約。 舉例來說，有人說汽車必然會推動道路發展。 然而，為了少數汽車打造全國性公路網絡並不符合經濟效應，人們因而發展出新的製造方法，以減少汽車的持有成本。 擁有車子的人變多，也會使道路意外的機率變高，進而使人類發展出修復受傷肢體的新醫護技術。
mt: The term "technological determinism" covers a number of already realized concepts, from technology-driven or technology-led change, to a more rigorous "the underlying logic of scientific laws and scientific forms of technology will drive human destiny." Most interpretations of technological determinism have two main ideas: that the path of technological development has a greater influence than cultural or political factors, and that technology in turn "affects" social forms rather than being constrained by them. For example, it is said that cars will drive road development. However, it does not make economic sense to build a national network of roads for a small number of cars, so new manufacturing methods are developed to reduce the cost of owning a car. As more people own cars, the probability of accidents increases, and new medical technology is developed to repair injured limbs.
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: 「上弓」標記長得像 V，「下弓」標記長得像訂書針，也像是底部開口的方形。 上表示您應該從弓尖開始推弓，下表示您應該從弓根（您的手握住弓的地方）開始拉弓。 上弓記號通常代表的是比較輕柔的聲響，而下弓記號則代表比較強烈又比較堅定的聲響。 請隨意用鉛筆做記號，但請記得，頁面上印出的運弓記號都有音樂上的作用，所以不應忽略。
mt: The "up bow" mark looks like a V, the "down bow" mark looks like a paper clip, or a square with an opening at the bottom. Up means you should start the bow from the bow tip, down means you should start the bow from the bow root (where your hand is holding the bow). The up bow mark usually represents a softer sound, while the down bow mark represents a stronger and more solid sound. Feel free to make your own marks with a pencil, but please remember that the bowing marks on the page have musical purposes, so don't ignore them.
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: 與其他靈長類動物不同，人類不再將雙手用於在樹木間移動、負重或擺盪。 黑猩猩手和腳的尺寸與長度相當，反映了牠們的手在握拳行走時承受重量的作用。 人類的手比腳短，且手的指骨較直。 兩百萬到三百萬年前的手骨化石，顯示從運動到操作，手部功能的轉變。
mt: Unlike other primates, humans no longer use their hands for moving through trees, carrying weight, or balancing. Black apes' hands and feet are about the same size and length, reflecting the role of their hands in supporting weight when walking on all fours. Humans' hands are shorter than their feet, and their finger bones are straighter. Two million to three million years ago, hand bones show a shift in function from movement to manipulation.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: 二十世紀的研究顯示有兩種基因變異：隱性和顯性。 突變會增加新的基因變異，而天擇則會將其從顯性變異庫中移除。 每一個世代，分離和重組會使得顯性和隱性兩組基因不斷產生變化。
mt: 20th century research showed there were two types of gene mutations: recessive and dominant. Mutations increased the number of new gene mutations, while natural selection removed them from the dominant gene pool. Each generation, separation and recombination caused the dominant and recessive gene pools to constantly change.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: 消化系統類似人類的靈長動物，難以從大草原上的植物攝取足夠的胺基酸。 此外，胺基酸攝取不足會導致嚴重的後果：生長不良及營養不良，最終導致死亡。 最方便取用的植物資源應是葉子和莢豆中可取得的蛋白質，但除非經過烹調，不然對像我們這樣的靈長類動物來說它們很難消化。 相對地，動物性食物 (螞蟻、白蟻、蛋) 不僅容易消化，並且提供含有所有必要胺基酸的優質蛋白。 考量所有因素後，如果我們的祖先解決「蛋白質問題」的方式與現今莽原上的黑猩猩類似，我們也無須感到驚訝。
mt: The digestive system of these primates is similar to ours, and they have difficulty extracting enough amino acids from the plants of the savanna. In addition, a lack of amino acids leads to serious consequences: stunted growth and malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most easily accessible plant resources are the proteins found in leaves and pods, but unless they are cooked, they are difficult to digest for primates like us. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) are easily digested and provide high-quality protein containing all the necessary amino acids. Considering all the factors, if our ancestors solved the "protein problem" in a way similar to the savanna chimpanzees, we should not be surprised.
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: 次文化讓喜好相似、且同樣覺得受社會主流忽視的人聚在一起，進而產生身分認同感。 次文化會因為成員的年齡層、種族、階級、地理位置或性別而特色鮮明。 使次文化得以確立的特質可能為語言、美學、宗教、政治、性別、地理或各種因素的結合。 次文化的成員通常透過特殊、有象徵意義的形式彰顯他們的屬於該群體，其中包括穿著打扮、行為舉止及暗語的使用。
mt: Subcultures are groups of people with shared tastes or interests, who feel marginalized by the mainstream. Subcultures are often characterized by distinctive styles of fashion, speech, or behavior. Members of subcultures often express their belonging to the group through the use of special, symbolic forms, including dress, behavior, and slang.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: 兒童很早就能意識到種族差異及種族刻板印象，而這些種族刻板印象會影響其行為。 比方說，人們對少數族裔抱有在校表現不良的刻板印象，自詡為此族裔的兒童得知此刻板印象與其種族的關聯後，在校表現也往往不良。
mt: Children are aware of racial differences and racial stereotypes at a young age, and these stereotypes affect their behavior. For example, people have a stereotype that members of a minority group are likely to perform poorly in school. When children who identify with that group learn of the stereotype and its association with their race, they often perform poorly in school as well.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: 常用於說明社會化重要性的一種方法，是舉幾則孩童在成長過程中遭受忽視、厄運或蓄意虐待，因而未獲得成人賦予社會化過程的不幸案例。 這種兒童稱為「野孩子」。有些野孩子曾遭受監禁（同常是父母）；在某些情況下，孩子遭到棄養是因為父母不接受孩子的智力或身體有嚴重缺陷。 流浪兒童被棄養或逃家前可能經歷嚴重受虐或創傷。 其他孩子據稱是由動物撫養長大；有些據說獨自在野外生活。 如果野孩子完全由非人類動物扶養長大，則會表現出與照顧他的動物幾乎完全相同的行為 (生理條件允許下)，例如對人類表現出害怕或冷漠的態度。
mt: A common method of explaining the importance of socialization is to cite cases of unfortunate children who, due to neglect, misfortune, or deliberate abuse, have not received the socialization process that adults provide. These children are called "wild children". Some wild children have been imprisoned (usually by their parents); in some cases, children were abandoned because their parents did not accept their intellectual or physical disabilities. Homeless children who were abandoned or ran away may have experienced severe abuse or trauma. Other children are said to have been raised by animals; some are said to have lived alone in the wild. If a wild child was completely raised by non-human animals, they will exhibit behaviors that are almost identical to the animals that raised them (physiological conditions permitting), such as exhibiting fear or indifference towards humans.
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: 自給自足式農業是作物產量只足夠讓農人和其家人溫飽的農業型態。 自給自足式農業是一種單純的農業系統，通常採行有機耕種，保留並使用當地生態區原生作物的種子，採用輪作或其他相對簡單的技術來增加產量。 歷史上，大部分的農民都從事自給自足農業，且許多開發中國家依舊如此。
mt: Self-sufficient agriculture is a farming system in which crop yields are just enough to feed the farmer and his family. Self-sufficient agriculture is a simple agricultural system, usually using organic tillage, preserving and using native crops' seeds, and using crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to increase yields. Historically, most farmers have practiced self-sufficient agriculture, and many developing countries still do.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: 也許最常見的旅遊型態正是多數人對旅行的聯想：休閒旅遊。 就是去一些跟日常生活環境截然不同的地方，放鬆玩樂。 海灘、主題公園和露營區通常是休閒遊客經常造訪的常見地方。 如果造訪特定地點的目的是為了瞭解其歷史及文化，則此類型的旅遊稱為文化之旅。 遊客可以造訪某國家的不同地標，或選擇聚焦於一個地區。
mt: 休閒旅遊最常見的旅遊型態正是多數人對旅行的聯想：休閒旅遊。 就是去一些跟日常生活環境截然不同的地方，放鬆玩樂。 海灘、主題公園和露營區通常是休閒遊客經常造訪的常見地方。 如果造訪特定地點的目的是為了瞭解其歷史及文化，則此類型的旅遊稱為文化之旅。 遊客可以造訪某國家的不同地標，或選擇聚焦於一個地區。
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: 數十年來的長期參與者，可協助我們了解自己的長處和熱情，並坦誠評估自己的困境，甚至是失敗。 聆聽個人分享自己、家庭和組織的故事時，我們會聽到寶貴的觀點，更深一層了解過去或對組織文化帶來正負面影響的人物。 儘管了解一個人的歷史並不代表了解文化，但這至少可以讓人理解他們在組織的歷史中處在什麼樣的位置上。 評估成功和漸漸意識到失敗的同時，個人和全體參與人員將更深入發現組織的價值、使命和驅動力。 在這種情況下，回想起過去的創業行為及成功經驗，可幫助人們樂於接受當地教會的新改變與新方向。 這種成功故事可以減弱對於改變的恐懼，同時讓人更願意接受未來的改變。
mt: For decades, long-term participants can help us understand our strengths and passions, and candidly assess our challenges, even failures. When we listen to personal stories about themselves, their families, and their organizations, we hear valuable perspectives and gain deeper insights into people who have had a positive or negative impact on the organization's culture. Although understanding one person's history does not mean understanding the culture, it at least helps us understand where they stand in the organization's history. Evaluating success and gradually becoming aware of failures, individuals and all participants will delve deeper into the organization's values, mission, and driving forces. In this case, recalling past entrepreneurial behavior and successful experiences can help people be willing to accept changes and new directions in the local church. This success story can reduce the fear of change and make people more willing to accept future changes.
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: 後現代的學習方法讓人能擺脫定則。學習的良方不只一種。 事實上，沒有什麼好事是特別要學習。學習發生在學習者與所呈現的知識間的經歷之中。 從我們目前對 DIY 和資訊呈現的經驗來看，以教學為主的電視節目說明了這一點。 因此，許多人會發現自己在電視節目中看到的是我們永遠都不會參與或應用的程序或經驗，我們永遠都用不到那些知識。 我們永遠不會去改造汽車、在後院蓋一座噴水池、去祕魯考察古代遺跡，或是翻修鄰居的房子。
mt: 21st century learning methods let us break the rules. There is no one right way to learn. Learning happens in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. From our current experience with DIY and information presentation, teaching shows this. Thus, many people find themselves watching on television programs that are procedures or experiences we will never participate in or apply, knowledge we will never use. We will never rebuild a car, build a fountain in the backyard, go to Peru to study ancient ruins, or fix our neighbor's house.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

mt: 21st century learning methods let us break the rules. There is no one right way to learn. Learning happens in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. From our current experience with DIY and information presentation, teaching shows this. Thus, many people find themselves watching on television programs that are procedures or experiences we will never participate in or apply, knowledge we will never use. We will never rebuild a car, build a fountain in the backyard, go to Peru to study ancient ruins, or fix our neighbor's house.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

src: 睡眠中斷意指刻意在一般的睡眠期間醒來，又在短時間內（10-60 分鐘後）入睡的過程。 藉由使用相對安靜的鬧鐘，讓你有意識卻不會完全醒來，就能輕鬆做到這件事。 如果你發現自己會在睡夢中重設鬧鐘，你可以把鬧鐘放在房間的另一邊，強迫自己下床關掉鬧鐘。 其他基於生理週期的選擇包括在睡前喝下大量液體（尤其是水或茶，一種公認的利尿劑），使人不得不起床排尿。
mt: Interrupted sleep means waking up intentionally during a normal sleep period and falling asleep again within a short time (10-60 minutes later). By using a relatively quiet alarm clock, you can easily do this while being conscious but not fully awake. If you find yourself resetting the alarm clock in your sleep, you can put the alarm clock in another room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn off the alarm clock. Other choices based on physiological cycles include drinking a large amount of liquid before going to bed (especially water or tea, a recognized diuretic), forcing you to get up to urinate.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: 有些人認為時常體驗多次人為誘發的清醒夢會變得非常疲倦。 這種現象的主要原因是，清醒夢增加了快速動眼期狀態的間隔時間。 由於快速動眼期是人實際入眠且身體修復的階段，如果每晚發生次數降至過低，就會產生問題。 這就跟您每二十或三十分鐘醒來看電視一樣累。 影響程度取決於你的腦袋每晚嘗試做清醒夢的頻率。
mt: Some people believe that experiencing lucid dreams multiple times per night can become very tiring. The main reason for this is that lucid dreams increase the intervals between REM states. REM is the actual state of sleep where your body repairs itself, and if the intervals are too low, problems will arise. This is like waking up every 20 or 30 minutes to watch TV. The degree of fatigue depends on how often your brain tries to lucid dream per night.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: 虛擬團隊必須遵守跟傳統團隊一樣的品質標準，但是有細微的差異。 虛擬團隊成員通常都是直接配合的實體團隊的聯絡點。 他們通常比傳統團隊成員擁有更多的自主權，因其團隊可能會配合不同的時區開會，他們的地方管理階層可能會無法理解這點。 具有名副其實的「隱形管理團隊」（摘自 Larson and LaFasto 1989 年的著作，第 109 頁） 也是個構成虛擬團隊的獨特要素。 「隱形團隊」是一個管理團隊，每一名成員都直屬於此團隊，並由此團隊為每位成員設下標準。
mt: Virtual teams must adhere to the same quality standards as traditional teams, but with subtle differences. Virtual team members are usually the direct liaisons to the physical team. They usually have more autonomy than traditional team members, as their teams may be working across time zones, and their local management may not understand this. The "invisible team" (as described in Larson and LaFasto's 1989 book, page 109) is also a unique element of virtual teams. The invisible team is a management team, with each member directly reporting to this team, and the team setting standards for each member.
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.
