src: 運河區（荷蘭語：Grachtengordel）圍繞著阿姆斯特丹的內城，是著名的 十七世紀城區。 由於其獨特的文化與歷史價值，這整個區域被聯合國教科文組織列為世界遺產，其地產價值屬國內最高。
mt: The Grachtengordel, or Canal Ring, surrounds the inner city of Amsterdam and is famous for its 17th-century architecture. The entire area is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and has the highest real estate values in the country.
ref: The Canal District (Dutch: Grachtengordel) is the famous 17th-century district surrounding the Binnenstad of Amsterdam. The whole district is designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its unique cultural and historical value, and its property values are among the highest of the country.

src: 豬山寺廟位於暹粒市西南方 12 公里處。這座山頂上的寺廟建於 9 世紀末，時值耶輸跋摩國王統治時期。 神廟陰鬱的氣氛和洞里薩湖的美景，讓攀登到山頂的這段路程值回票價。 入園參觀行程可與乘船遊湖行程合併，十分便利。 必須持吳哥窟通行證才能進入神廟，所以去洞里薩湖時別忘了帶吳哥窟門票。
mt: The temple is located 12 kilometers southwest of Siem Reap. The temple was built in the late 9th century during the reign of Jayavarman II. The temple's dark atmosphere and the beauty of Tonle Sap Lake make the climb to the top of the mountain worth the price of admission. The temple can be visited in conjunction with a boat tour of Tonle Sap Lake, which is very convenient. You must have a pass to Angkor Wat to enter the temple, so don't forget to bring your Angkor Wat ticket when you go to Tonle Sap Lake.
ref: Phnom Krom, 12 km southwest of Siem Reap. This hilltop temple was built at the end of the 9th century, during the reign of King Yasovarman. The gloomy atmosphere of the temple and the view over the Tonle Sap lake make the climb to the hill worthwhile. A visit to the site can be conveniently combined with a boat trip to the lake. The Angkor Pass is needed to enter the temple so do not forget to bring your passport along when heading to Tonle Sap.

src: 圍繞南極的南極洲是地球上最冷的地方。 遊客來訪的花費頗高、需要體力、只能在 夏季 11 月到 2 月間進行，且範圍多限制在半島、島嶼和羅斯海。 在夏天，有數千名人員在近五十座基地內（多數位於那些地區）生活；少數人會留下過冬。 南極洲內陸是一片荒蕪的高原，上面覆蓋著 2-3 公里厚的冰層。 專家偶爾會搭機進入南極州內陸登山，或前往位在南極點的大型基地。
mt: The Antarctic is the coldest, driest, and windiest continent and is known as the "top of the world" or "bottom of the world." Visitors are expensive, require physical fitness, and can only be made in the summer months of November to February, and the range is mostly limited to the peninsula, islands, and Ross Sea. In the summer, there are thousands of people living in about fifty bases (mostly in those areas) and a few people will stay over the winter. The interior of the Antarctic is a barren highland covered by 2-3 km thick ice. Experts occasionally fly into the interior of the Antarctic to climb or visit the large base at the South Pole.
ref: Antarctica is the coldest place on Earth, and surrounds the South Pole. Tourist visits are costly, demand physical fitness, can only take place in summer Nov-Feb, and are largely limited to the Peninsula, Islands and Ross Sea. A couple of thousand staff live here in summer in some four dozen bases mostly in those areas; a small number stay over winter. Inland Antarctica is a desolate plateau covered by 2-3 km of ice. Occasional specialist air tours go inland, for mountaineering or to reach the Pole, which has a large base.

src: 前現代的天文台在今日通常已過時，並繼續當成博物館或教育場所來用。 由於光害在前現代天文台的全盛時期沒有如今嚴重，它們通常坐落在城市或校園中，比現代建造的那些天文台更容易到達。 大部分現代研究型望遠鏡都是巨大的設施，座落於有大氣條件良好的偏遠地區。
mt: Most pre-modern observatories are now obsolete and continue to be used as museums or educational facilities. Because light pollution was not as severe during the heyday of pre-modern observatories, they are typically located in cities or campuses, and are easier to access than modern observatories. Most modern research telescopes are large facilities located in remote areas with good atmospheric conditions.
ref: Pre-modern observatories are usually obsolete today, and remain as museums, or sites of education. As light pollution in their heyday was not the kind of problem it is today, they are usually located in cities or at campuses, easier to reach than those built in modern times. Most modern research telescopes are enormous facilities in remote areas with favorable atmospheric conditions.

src: 奧克蘭跨越 2 座海港，因此擁有許多海灘。最受歡迎的海灘位於 3 個區域。 北岸海灘（北港區）位於太平洋沿岸，從北邊的長灣一路延伸到南邊的德文港。 那些地方幾乎都是能讓人安全游泳的沙灘，且大多數都有紐西蘭聖誕樹提供的樹蔭。 塔瑪基大道海灘位於懷特瑪塔港，在奧克蘭中央的米慎海灣與聖赫利爾的高級郊區。 這些是有時擁擠的家庭海灘，岸邊有成排的商店林立。在這裡游泳很安全。
mt: 2 harbours cross Auckland, so it has many beaches. The most popular beaches are in 3 areas. North Shore beaches are on the Pacific Ocean, from Northcote Bay in the north to Devonport in the south. Most of these are safe for swimming and most have shade from New Zealand Christmas trees. Tamaki Drive beaches are in the central suburb of Mission Bay and St Heliers, a high-class suburb of Auckland. These are family beaches that can be crowded, with shops along the shore. Swimming is safe here.
ref: There are many beaches, due to Auckland's straddling of two harbours. The most popular ones are in three areas. North Shore beaches (in North Harbour district) are on the Pacific Ocean and stretch from Long Bay in the north to Devonport in the south. They are almost all sandy beaches with safe swimming, and most have shade provided by pohutukawa trees. Tamaki Drive beaches are on the Waitemata Harbour, in the upmarket suburbs of Mission Bay and St Heliers in Central Auckland. These are sometimes-crowded family beaches with a good range of shops lining the shore. Swimming is safe.

src: 奧克蘭跨越 2 座海港，因此擁有許多海灘。最受歡迎的海灘位於 3 個區域。 北岸海灘（北港區）位於太平洋沿岸，從北邊的長灣一路延伸到南邊的德文港。 那些地方幾乎都是能讓人安全游泳的沙灘，且大多數都有紐西蘭聖誕樹提供的樹蔭。 塔瑪基大道海灘位於懷特瑪塔港，在奧克蘭中央的米慎海灣與聖赫利爾的高級郊區。 這些是有時擁擠的家庭海灘，岸邊有成排的商店林立。在這裡游泳很安全。

src: 輔助語言是人工或建構而成的，旨在輔助有溝通障礙的人們互相溝通。 它們與通用語有所區別，是因某種原因而成為其他語言使用者之間的交流方式，所以成為主要語言。
mt: Auxiliary languages are artificial or constructed, and are intended to assist people with communication difficulties. They are distinguished from general languages, which are used by a large number of people, and are used as a means of communication between people who speak different languages.
ref: Auxiliary languages are artificial or constructed languages created with the intent of facilitating communication between peoples who would otherwise have difficulty communicating. They are separate from lingua francas, which are natural or organic languages that become dominant for one reason or another as means of communication between speakers of other languages.

src: 巴塞隆納的官方語言是加泰隆尼亞語和西班牙語。約有一半的人口比較喜歡講加泰隆尼亞語，絕大多數的人都聽得懂，而幾乎所有人都懂西班牙語。 不過，大部分的標誌都只用加泰隆語顯示，因為它是法律規定的第一官方語言。 不過，西班牙語也被廣泛地使用在大眾運輸與其他場所。 地鐵中的固定廣播只有加泰羅尼亞語，但自動化系統也會以西班牙語、英語、法語、阿拉伯語、日語等多國語言進行意料之外的插播。
mt: 1. The official language of Barcelona is Catalan and Spanish. About half the population prefers to speak Catalan, most people understand it, and almost everyone speaks Spanish. However, most signs are only in Catalan, because it is the first official language by law. However, Spanish is widely used in public transportation and other places. The fixed broadcast in the metro is only in Catalan, but the automated system also inserts unexpected messages in Spanish, English, French, Arabic, Japanese, etc.
ref: Barcelona's official languages are Catalan and Spanish. About a half prefer to speak Catalan, a vast majority understands it, and virtually everyone knows Spanish. However, most signs are indicated only in Catalan because it is established by law as the first official language. Yet, Spanish is also widely used in public transport and other facilities. Regular announcements in the Metro are made only in Catalan, but unplanned disruptions are announced by an automated system in a wide variety of languages including Spanish, English, French, Arabic and Japanese.

src: 在今日的已開發國家，提供豪華的 B&B 服務已經提升為一種藝術。 在高端市場中，民宿業者主要的競爭項目明顯為兩大項：寢具用品和早餐。 因此，在最頂級的這類場所容易找到最奢華的寢具，也許是手工被單或骨董床。 早餐可能包含當地的季節性美食或民宿主人的特製佳餚。 那可能是一棟具歷史意義的老建築，擁有古董家具、修剪整齊的庭園和游泳池。
mt: In today's developed countries, providing luxurious B&B services has become an art. In the high-end market, the main competition items for the B&B operators are clearly two: bedding and breakfast. Therefore, the most luxurious bedding can be found in the most luxurious places of this kind, perhaps handmade duvets or antique beds. Breakfast may include local seasonal delicacies or the B&B owner's special dishes. It may be an old building with historical significance, with antique furniture, well-kept gardens and a swimming pool.
ref: In developed countries today, providing deluxe bed and breakfasts has been raised to a sort of art-form. At the top end, B&Bs obviously compete mainly on two main things: bedding and breakfast. Accordingly, at the finest such establishments one is apt to find the most luxurious bedding, maybe a handmade quilt or an antique bed. Breakfast may include seasonal delights of the region or the host's speciality dish. The setting might be an historic old building with antique furnishings, manicured grounds and a swimming pool.

src: 中國的北京市將主辦 2022 年的冬季奧林匹克運動會，這將使北京成為第一座主辦過夏季與冬季奧運的城市。 北京將主辦開幕及閉幕式，還有室內冰上項目。 其他滑雪活動將在張家口的太子城滑雪區進行，距離北京約 220 公里（140 英里）。
mt: 2022 Winter Olympics will be held in Beijing, China, making it the first city to host both summer and winter Olympics. src: 維京人從俄羅斯的航道進入黑海和裏海。目前有一部份的航道仍可通行，請留意是否需要特殊許可，有些許可不易取得。 白海-波羅的海運河經過奧涅加湖、拉多加湖和聖彼得堡，主要以河川和湖泊將北極海和波羅的海連在一起。 奧涅加湖也和窩瓦河相連，因此仍有可能從裏海穿過俄羅斯來到這裡。
mt: The Volga River flows into the Caspian Sea. The Volga is the longest river in Europe, and the largest river by volume of water flowing into the Caspian Sea. The river is also widely viewed as the national river of Russia.
ref: Vikings used the Russian waterways to get to the Black Sea and Caspian Sea. Parts of these routes can still be used. Check possible need for special permits, which may be difficult to get. The White Sea–Baltic Canal connects the Arctic Ocean to the Baltic Sea, via Lake Onega, Lake Ladoga and Saint Petersburg, mostly by rivers and lakes. Lake Onega is also connected to Volga, so coming from the Caspian Sea through Russia is still possible.

src: 步出飛機、船隻或其他交通工具時，入境檢查站通常都是第一站。 某些跨越邊境的火車會在行進時進行檢查，因此搭乘這種火車時，你應該攜帶有效的身分證明。 搭乘夜間臥鋪火車時，列車長可能會將護照收走，這樣就不會打斷你的睡眠。
mt: 1. When you disembark from a plane, ship, or other form of transportation, the first stop is usually the immigration checkpoint. Some cross-border trains are checked while in motion, so when you take one of these trains, you should carry a valid proof of identity. When you take a night sleeper train, the conductor may take your passport away, so that your sleep will not be interrupted.
ref: An immigration checkpoint is usually the first stop when disembarking from a plane, a ship, or another vehicle. In some cross-border trains inspections are done on the running train and you should have valid ID with you when boarding one of those trains. On night sleeper trains, passports may be collected by the conductor so that you do not have your sleep interrupted.

src: 新加坡大體上是極安全的去處，交通非常便利，入境後你幾乎什麼都能買到。 但由於地處赤道以北僅幾度之遙的「高熱帶地區」，您將需要同時應付（一向的）高溫和熾烈陽光（天空晴朗的情況下，這種情形比較少見）。
mt: Singapore is generally a safe place to be, and transportation is very convenient. Upon arrival, you can buy almost anything. However, being in the "high-tropical region" just a few degrees north of the equator, you will need to deal with both high temperatures and intense sunlight (this is less common when the sky is clear).
ref: "Singapore is generally an extremely safe place to be and very easy to navigate, and you can buy almost anything after arriving. But being placed in the ""high tropics"" just a few degrees north of equator you will need to deal with both heat (always) and strong sun (when the sky is clear, more rarely)."

src: 德國糕點十分美味，而巴伐利亞邦的糕點則豐富且多樣，與他們的南方鄰居奧地利相似。 水果糕點很普遍，蘋果常年被製作成糕點，櫻桃與李子則在夏日會出現在餐桌上。 許多德國的烘焙食品中常含有杏仁、榛果和其他木本堅果。而熱門的蛋糕品項通常特別適合搭配一杯濃厚的咖啡。 如果你想要一些小巧又有飽足感的點心，可以試試一種油炸果醬包，它依據地區有不同名稱：Berliner、Pfannkuchen 或 Krapfen。
mt: German pastries are delicious, and those from Bavaria are rich and varied, similar to their southern neighbors in Austria. Fruit pastries are common, apples are baked into pastries year-round, and cherries and plums appear on the table in the summer. Many German baked goods contain almonds, hazelnuts, and other hardy nuts. The most popular cake items are often best paired with a strong cup of coffee. If you want something small and satisfying, try a fried fruit tart, which goes by different names depending on the region: Berliner, Pfannkuchen, or Krapfen.
ref: German pastries are quite good, and in Bavaria, are quite rich and varied, similar to those of their southern neighbor, Austria. Fruit pastries are common, with apples cooked into pastries year round, and cherries and plums making their appearances during the summer. Many German baked goods also feature almonds, hazelnuts, and other tree nuts. Popular cakes often pair particularly well with a cup of strong coffee. If you want some small though rich pastries, try what depending on region are called Berliner, Pfannkuchen or Krapfen.

ref: If you want to see the world on the cheap, for necessity, lifestyle or challenge, there are some ways to do that. src: 波恩馬里恩和費爾蒙特之間的路段，途中經過許多偏僻的荒涼地區，堪稱水牛城─匹茲堡高速公路上駕駛難度最高的路段。 若您不習慣在鄉村道路上駕駛，請保持頭腦清醒：陡坡、窄道和急彎占了絕大多數。 速限公告明顯低於前一段路和下一段路，一般為 35 至 40 英里 / 小時（56 至 64 公里 / 小時），嚴格遵守這些速限甚至比其他路段更重要。 不過令人好奇的是，這裡的行動通訊服務比沿途其他路段還要強得多，例如賓州野地。
mt: The road between Boone, North Carolina and Fayetteville, West Virginia is one of the most difficult to drive in the country. It passes through many remote and desolate areas, and is known as the "Buffalo Trace" of the Pittsburgh-Boone Highway. If you are not used to driving in rural areas, please keep your head clear: steep slopes, narrow roads, and sharp turns make up the majority of the road. Speed limits are clearly lower than the previous and next sections, usually between 35 and 40 miles per hour (56 and 64 kilometers per hour), and strictly following these speed limits is even more important than other sections. However, it is interesting that the mobile service here is stronger than other sections along the way, such as West Virginia's wilderness.
ref: The stretch between Point Marion and Fairmont presents the most challenging driving conditions on the Buffalo-Pittsburgh Highway, passing frequently through isolated backwoods terrain. If you're not used to driving on country roads, keep your wits about you: steep grades, narrow lanes, and sharp curves predominate. Posted speed limits are noticeably lower than in previous and subsequent sections — commonly 35-40 mph (56-64 km/h) — and strict obedience to them is even more important than otherwise. Curiously, though, mobile phone service is much stronger here than along many other stretches of the route, e.g. the Pennsylvania Wilds.

src: 溪降（canyoning 或 canyoneering ）是前往峽谷底部的運動，峽谷底可能是乾涸或滿水狀態。 溪降結合了游泳、攀爬和跳躍等要素，但訓練或身體狀態的入門要求相對較低（例如相較於攀岩、水肺潛水或高山滑雪）。
mt: Caving is a sport that involves descending into a canyon, where the bottom may be dry or full of water. Caving combines elements of swimming, climbing, and jumping, but the entry requirements for training or physical condition are relatively low (for example, compared to rock climbing, scuba diving, or alpine skiing).
ref: Canyoning (or: canyoneering) is about going in a bottom of a canyon, which is either dry or full of water. Canyoning combines elements from swimming, climbing and jumping--but requires relatively little training or physical shape to get started (compared to rock climbing, scuba diving or alpine skiing, for example).

src: 坐上自己的汽車，展開一場漫長的公路之旅，這種簡單的旅行方式本身就非常有吸引力。 與大型車輛不同，你很可能已經對於駕駛自己的車輛很熟悉，也了解它的侷限。 在私人土地或任何大小的城鎮搭起帳棚，都很容易引起不必要的注意。 簡而言之，開車是進行公路旅行的好方式，但那本身鮮少是一種「露營」方式。 如果您有一輛座椅能放平的大型迷你廂型車、休旅車、轎車或是旅行車，便能從事汽車露營。
mt: Get in your own car and embark on a long road trip, and the simple act of driving itself is very appealing. Unlike large vehicles, you are likely very familiar with your own vehicle and know its limitations. Setting up a tent on private land or in any size town is easy to avoid unnecessary attention. In short, driving is a good way to do a road trip, but it is rarely a "camping" way. If you have a large minivan, SUV, sedan, or wagon with a flat seat, you can do car camping.
ref: "Getting into your own car and heading off on a long road trip has an intrinsic appeal in its simplicity. Unlike larger vehicles, you are probably already familiar with driving your car and know its limitations. Setting up a tent on private property or in a town of any size can easily attract unwanted attention. In short, using your car is a great way to take a road trip but seldom in itself a way to ""camp"". Car camping is possible if you have a large minivan, SUV, Sedan or Station Wagon with seats that lay down."

src: 卡薩布蘭卡的現代城市由柏柏爾的漁民在西元前 10 世紀建立。腓尼基人、羅馬人和馬里尼德人曾將其作為戰略港口使用，稱為安法。 葡萄牙人將這座城市夷平重建，並命名為「Casa Branca」（白色房子），在 1755 年發生地震後又遺棄了這個地方。 摩洛哥蘇丹重建了這座城市，取名 「達魯 I 巴迪亞」。而「卡薩布蘭卡」則是在此建立貿易基地的西班牙貿易商為它取的名稱。 卡薩布蘭卡是全摩洛哥境內最無趣的購物處之一。 麥地那舊城一帶可輕易找到販售傳統摩洛哥商品的地方，包括塔吉鍋、陶器、皮製品、水煙及各式各樣的花俏飾品，但這些都是賣給遊客的。
mt: The modern city of Casablanca was founded by Berber fishermen in the 10th century BC. The Phoenicians, Romans and Marinids used it as a strategic port, calling it Anfa. The Portuguese razed and rebuilt the city, naming it Casa Branca (White House), which was abandoned after the 1755 earthquake. The Sultan rebuilt the city, naming it Dar al-Baida. The name Casablanca was given to it by Spanish traders who established a trading post there. Casablanca is one of the least interesting shopping places in all of Morocco. The old Medina area of Medina is easy to find where you can buy traditional Moroccan goods, including tajines, pottery, leather goods, water pipes and all kinds of fancy trinkets, but these are all sold to tourists.
ref: The modern city of Casablanca was founded by Berber fishermen in the 10th century BCE, and was used by the Phoenicians, Romans, and the Merenids as a strategic port called Anfa. The Portuguese destroyed it and rebuilt it under the name Casa Branca, only to abandon it after an earthquake in 1755. The Moroccan sultan rebuilt the city as Daru l-Badya and it was given the name Casablanca by Spanish traders who established trading bases there. Casablanca is one of the least interesting places to shop in all of Morocco. Around the old Medina it's easy to find places selling traditional Moroccan goods, such as tagines, pottery, leather goods, hookahs, and a whole spectrum of geegaws, but it's all for the tourists.

src: 往北不遠處是浪漫且迷人的城鎮──辛特拉，這裡對外國人來說非常有名，因為拜倫男爵曾對它的美景進行過鮮明的描繪。 Scotturb 公車 403 會固定開往辛特拉，停靠在羅卡角。 也可以前往北方造訪非凡的花地瑪聖母朝聖地，那是世界聞名的聖母顯靈處。
mt: To the north is the romantic and picturesque town of Sintra, which is well known to foreigners because of the vivid descriptions of its beauty by Lord Byron. Scotturb bus 403 will take you to Sintra, stopping at Praia da Rocha. You can also visit the extraordinary Sanctuary of Our Lady of Fátima, a world-famous Marian apparition site.
ref: To the north and within easy reach is the romantic and fascinating town of Sintra and which was made famous to foreigners after a glowing account of its splendours recorded by Lord Byron. Scotturb Bus 403 travels regularly to Sintra, stopping at Cabo da Roca. Also to the north visit the great Sanctuary of Our Lady of Fatima (Shrine), a place of worldwide famous Marian apparitions.

src: 1994 年，以亞美尼亞人居多的亞塞拜然納戈爾諾－卡拉巴赫地區向亞塞拜然人發動了戰爭。 在亞美尼亞人的支持下，新的共和國誕生了。然而，沒有任何已成立的國家正式承認它，就連亞美尼亞也不承認。 關於此地區的外交爭論持續損害亞美尼亞和亞塞拜然之間的關係。
mt: 1994 saw a war launched by the mostly Armenian population of the Nagorno-Karabakh region against the mostly Azerbaijani population. A new republic was born with the support of Armenia, but no existing country formally recognized it, not even Armenia. Diplomatic wrangling over the region continues to damage relations between Armenia and Azerbaijan.
ref: In 1994, the ethnically Armenian Nagorno-Karabakh region of Azerbaijan waged war against the Azeris. With Armenian backing, a new republic was created. However, no established nation - not even Armenia - officially recognizes it. Diplomatic arguments over the region continue to mar relations between Armenia and Azerbaijan.

src: 北卡羅萊納州的夏洛特有一個很大的優點，那就是親子家庭有很多高品質的選擇。 家庭友善時常是居民從外地遷居此處的主要原因，也有很多遊客認為能輕鬆和孩子一起享受這座城市。 過去 20 年，夏洛特上城區適合兒童去的地方數量倍增。 一般而言夏洛特市的家庭通常不會使用計程車，但在特定情況下使用計程車十分方便。 超過兩名乘客需支付額外的費用，所以這個做法可能會多花不必要的錢。
mt: 1. One of the biggest advantages of Charlotte, North Carolina, is that there are many high-quality options for families with children. Family-friendly activities are often the main reason residents move to the area from elsewhere, and many visitors find it easy to enjoy the city with their kids. Over the past 20 years, the number of places in uptown Charlotte that are suitable for children has increased. 2. In general, families in Charlotte do not use taxis, but it is convenient to use a taxi in certain situations. 3. It costs extra to have more than two passengers, so this may be unnecessary.
ref: One of strong points of Charlotte, North Carolina, is that it has an abundance of high-quality options for families. Residents from other areas often cite family-friendliness as a primary reason for moving there, and visitors often find the city easy to enjoy with children around. In the past 20 years, the amount of child-friendly options in Uptown Charlotte has grown exponentially. Taxis are not generally used by families in Charlotte, though they can be of some use in certain circumstances. There is a surcharge for having more than 2 passengers, so this option might be more expensive than necessary.

src: 在西班牙人於 16 世紀抵達智利前，其北部受印加帝國統治，中部及南部則居住著原住民阿勞卡尼亞人（馬普切人）。 馬普切人也是最後一群獨立的美洲原住民團體之一，他們直到智利獨立後，才完全被納入西班牙語的治理。 雖然智利在 1810 年即宣佈獨立（當時正值拿破侖戰爭，西班牙有好幾年都沒有正常運作的中央政府），但直到 1818 年才擊敗西班牙，取得決定性的勝利。
mt: Before the Spanish arrived in Chile in the 16th century, its north was ruled by the Inca Empire, and its center and south were inhabited by the indigenous Araucanians (Mapuche). The Mapuche were also one of the last independent groups of indigenous Americans, and they were not fully incorporated into the Spanish-speaking regime until after the independence of Chile in 1810 (which occurred during the Napoleonic Wars, when Spain had no functioning central government for several years).
ref: Before the Spanish arrived in the 16th century, northern Chile was under Inca rule while the indigenous Araucanians (Mapuche) inhabited central and southern Chile. The Mapuche were also one of the last independent American indigenous groups, that were not fully absorbed into Spanish-speaking rule until after Chile's independence. Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (amid the Napoleonic wars that left Spain without a functioning central government for a couple of years), decisive victory over the Spanish was not achieved until 1818.

mt: Before the Spanish arrived in Chile in the 16th century, its north was ruled by the Inca Empire, and its center and south were inhabited by the indigenous Araucanians (Mapuche). The Mapuche were also one of the last independent groups of indigenous Americans, and they were not fully incorporated into the Spanish-speaking regime until after the independence of Chile in 1810 (which occurred during the Napoleonic Wars, when Spain had no functioning central government for several years).
ref: Before the Spanish arrived in the 16th century, northern Chile was under Inca rule while the indigenous Araucanians (Mapuche) inhabited central and southern Chile. The Mapuche were also one of the last independent American indigenous groups, that were not fully absorbed into Spanish-speaking rule until after Chile's independence. Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (amid the Napoleonic wars that left Spain without a functioning central government for a couple of years), decisive victory over the Spanish was not achieved until 1818.

src: 五鄉地，意思是五塊土地，由義大利利古里亞地區的五座濱海小村莊組成，包括里奧馬哲雷、馬納羅拉、科爾尼利亞、維爾納沙和蒙特羅索。 它們被列入聯合國教科文組織世界遺產的清單中。 幾個世紀以來，人們在崎嶇且陡峭的地景上精心建造平臺，一路直達可以俯瞰大海的懸崖上。 看不到企業進入的低度開發是它的魅力之一。步道、火車與船隻串起了村莊，而汽車卻無法從外頭開進這裡。
mt: 5 Lands, meaning 5 pieces of land, are five coastal villages in the Ligurian region of Italy, including Riomaggiore, Manarola, Corniglia, Vernazza, and Monterosso. They are listed in the UNESCO World Heritage Site. For centuries, people have carefully built platforms on rugged and steep terrain, all the way to the cliffs overlooking the sea. One of its charms is its low development. Paths, trains, and boats connect the villages, while cars cannot enter from outside.
ref: Cinque Terre, which means Five Lands, comprises the five small coastal villages of Riomaggiore, Manarola, Corniglia, Vernazza and Monterosso located in the Italian region of Liguria. They are listed on the UNESCO World Heritage List. Over the centuries, people have carefully built terraces on the rugged, steep landscape right up to the cliffs that overlook the sea. Part of its charm is the lack of visible corporate development. Paths, trains and boats connect the villages, and cars cannot reach them from the outside.

src: 冬天最常見的意外成因是溼滑的馬路、人行道、及最容易發生危險的階梯。 你至少需要合適的鞋底。夏季鞋類在冰面和雪地上通常會打滑，某些冬季靴款甚至也不足以止滑。 鞋底紋路應當夠深，至少達 5 公釐（1/5 英寸），且材質在冷天中仍保持柔軟。 有些靴子帶有鞋釘，也有專為溼滑環境而設、適用於多數鞋子與靴子的拆卸式鞋釘，可僅裝配在鞋跟，或在鞋跟、鞋底皆裝。 鞋跟應低且寬。道路或步道上常灑上沙子、碎石或鹽（氯化鈣），以增加摩擦力。
mt: 1. The most common cause of winter accidents is slippery roads, sidewalks, and most dangerous of all, stairs. You need appropriate footwear. Summer shoes are often slippery on ice and snow, and some winter boots are not slip-resistant enough. Tread patterns should be deep, at least 1/5 inch, and the material should remain flexible in cold weather. Some boots have studs, and there are removable studs that fit most shoes and boots, which can be installed on the sole or on the sole and heel. Heels should be low and wide. Roads and sidewalks are often sprinkled with sand, gravel, or salt (calcium chloride) to increase friction.
ref: The most common cause for accidents in winter is slippery roads, pavements (sidewalks) and especially steps. At a minimum, you need footwear with suitable soles. Summer shoes are usually very slippery on ice and snow, even some winter boots are deficient. The pattern should be deep enough, 5 mm (1/5 inch) or more, and the material soft enough in cold temperatures. Some boots have studs and there is studded add-on equipment for slippery conditions, suitable for most shoes and boots, for the heels or heels and sole. Heels should be low and wide. Sand, gravel or salt (calcium chloride) is often scattered on roads or paths to improve traction.

src: 庫克群島是一個與紐西蘭自由結盟的島國，位於南太平洋中部的玻里尼西亞。 這是由 15 座島嶼組成的群島，遍佈在 220 萬平方公里的海上。 因為群島跟夏威夷同時區，所以有時又被稱為「南半球夏威夷」。 雖然面積較小，但此處會讓一些年長旅客想起尚未成為美國一州、大型觀光飯店與其他開發案還沒進駐的夏威夷。 庫克群島沒有任何城市，而是由十五個不同島嶼組成。主要島嶼是拉羅湯加島及艾圖塔基島。
mt: Cook Islands is a self-governing island country in the South Pacific Ocean in free association with New Zealand. It comprises 15 islands whose total land area is 224.6 square kilometres (86.7 sq mi). The Cook Islands' Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ), however, covers 2,000,000 square kilometres (770,000 sq mi) of ocean. The Cook Islands' 12 islands, where most of the population lives, are quality tourist destinations. Rarotonga, where most government departments are located, is the most populous island while Aitutaki is the most remote. The nation's capital is Penrhyn (also called Pukapuka). The Cook Islands' parliament is located in Avarua on Rarotonga.
ref: "The Cook Islands are an island country in free association with New Zealand, located in Polynesia, in the middle of the South Pacific Ocean. It is an archipelago with 15 islands spread out over 2.2 million km2 of ocean. With the same time zone as Hawaii, the islands are sometimes thought of as ""Hawaii down under"". Though smaller, it reminds some elderly visitors of Hawaii before statehood without all the large tourist hotels and other development. The Cook Islands do not have any cities but are composed of 15 different islands. The main ones are Rarotonga and Aitutaki."

src: 許可證必須事先預訂。你必須擁有許可證才能在錫雷納過夜。 只有西雷納林區管理站提供露營地以外的合宿房與熱食。拉萊歐那、聖佩德里羅和洛斯帕托斯只提供露營地，不提供食物。 您可能可以直接從希門尼斯港的公園管理處預定通行證，但他們不收信用卡。 公園管理處（哥斯大黎加環境能源部）只簽發預計抵達時間在一個月內的許可證。 El Sol 網咖提供預約服務，費用為美金 $30，或一日票 $10；更多訊息請見科爾科瓦杜國家公園相關頁面。
mt: You must have a permit to spend the night in the park. Only the SINAC office provides lodging and food outside of the campgrounds. La Leona, San Pedro and Los Patos only provide campgrounds and no food. You may be able to reserve a permit directly from the park office in Hacienda, but they do not take credit cards. The park office (Ministry of Environment and Energy) only issues permits for arrivals within one month. El Sol Internet Cafe provides reservation services for $30 or $10 per day; more information can be found on the Corcovado National Park page.
ref: Permits must be reserved in advance. You must have a permit to stay overnight at Sirena. Sirena is the only ranger station that offers dormitory lodging and hot meals in addition to camping. La Leona, San Pedrillo, and Los Patos offer only camping with no food service. It is possible to secure park permits directly from the Ranger Station in Puerto Jiménez, but they do not accept credit cards The Park Service (MINAE) does not issue park permits more than one month in advance of anticipated arrival. CafeNet El Sol offers a reservation service for a fee of US$30, or $10 for one-day passes; details on their Corcovado page.

src: 滑雪背包客：此活動也稱作為山岳滑雪﹑滑雪旅遊或滑雪登山。 此活動與阿爾卑斯式登山滑雪類似，但通常不涉及高山滑雪與登山，這兩種活動在陡峭地形中進行，需要更堅固的滑雪板和雪靴。 把滑雪路線想像成類似的健行路線。 狀況好的時候，雪地負重滑行的距離將比徒步健走稍微長一些，但你鮮少在淨空雪道上達到無重裝越野滑雪的速度。
mt: Backcountry skiers: This activity is also called alpine touring, ski touring, or ski mountaineering. It is similar to alpine mountaineering skiing, but usually does not involve high alpine skiing and mountaineering, which are performed on steep terrain, requiring sturdier skis and snowshoes. Imagine ski routes as similar hiking routes. In good conditions, the distance you can travel on snowshoes with a load will be slightly longer than hiking, but you rarely reach the speed of cross-country skiing in clean snow.
ref: Backpacking by ski: This activity is also called backcountry ski, ski touring or ski hiking. It is related to but usually not involving alpine style ski touring or mountaineering, the latter ones done in steep terrain and requiring much stiffer skis and boots. Think of the skiing route as of a similar hiking route. In good conditions you will be able to cover somewhat greater distances than walking – but only very seldom you will get the speeds of cross country skiing without a heavy backpack in groomed tracks.

src: 逆向文化衝擊的出現速度比文化衝擊快（較無蜜月期），持續時間較長，也比較嚴重。 對於容易適應新文化的遊客來說，有時重新調整融入自身的本土文化反而特別難。 在國外居住一段時間回國後，你已經適應了新文化，並且遺忘國內文化讓你養成的某些習慣。 剛到國外時，別人知道初到陌生國家的旅客需要時間適應，大多會以耐心和諒解的態度對待你。 但對於歸鄉遊子，人們可能覺得沒必要再擔待和理解他們。
mt: 1. The speed of reverse culture shock is faster than culture shock (no honeymoon period), longer and more serious. For tourists who are easy to adapt to new cultures, it is often particularly difficult to re-adjust and integrate into their own native cultures. After living abroad for a period of time, you have adapted to the new culture and forgotten the domestic culture that you have developed some habits. When you first arrive in a foreign country, people know that tourists need time to adapt, and most will be patient and tolerant of you. But for the returnees, people may feel that there is no need to bear and understand them.
ref: Re-entry shock comes on sooner than culture shock (there's less of a honeymoon phase), lasts longer, and can be more severe. Travellers who had an easy time adjusting to the new culture sometimes have a particularly hard time readjusting to their native culture. When returning home after living abroad, you've adapted to the new culture and lost some of your habits from your home culture. When you went abroad at first, people were probably patient and understanding, knowing that travellers in a new country need to adapt. People may not anticipate that patience and understanding are also necessary for travellers returning home.

mt: Deer (commonly called moose) are not naturally aggressive, but will defend themselves if threatened. If people think deer are not likely to be dangerous, they may get too close and put themselves in danger.
ref: Moose (also known as elk) aren't inherently aggressive, but will defend themselves if they perceive a threat. When people don't see moose as potentially dangerous, they may approach too closely and put themselves at risk.

src: 在一天最炎熱的時候，旅客可以看見海市蜃樓造成的水（或其他東西）的影像。 浪費寶貴的能量與剩下的水去追逐海市蜃樓，對旅行者來說是一件很危險的事。 即便是最熱的沙漠，夜晚也會變得極冷。若不穿上保暖衣物，就真的會有失溫的風險。
mt: 1. In the hottest part of the day, travelers can see mirages of water (or other things). Wasting precious energy and remaining water to chase mirages is a dangerous thing to do. Even the hottest desert will become very cold at night. If you don't wear warm clothes, you will really risk hypothermia.
ref: In the heat of the day, travelers can experience mirages that give the illusion of water (or other things). These can be dangerous if the traveler pursue the mirage, wasting precious energy and remaining water. Even the hottest of deserts can become extremely cold at night. Hypothermia is a real risk without warm clothing.

src: 在一天最炎熱的時候，旅客可以看見海市蜃樓造成的水（或其他東西）的影像。 浪費寶貴的能量與剩下的水去追逐海市蜃樓，對旅行者來說是一件很危險的事。 即便是最熱的沙漠，夜晚也會變得極冷。若不穿上保暖衣物，就真的會有失溫的風險。

src: 多明尼加共和國（西班牙文：República Dominicana）是一個加勒比海國家，和西邊的海地共同位於伊斯帕尼奧拉島上。 除了白色沙灘和山岳景觀，這個國家也是美洲最古老的歐式城市的所在地，就是現在是聖多明哥的一部份。 此島最初的居民為泰諾人與加勒比人。加勒比人說的是阿拉瓦語系，在約公元前一萬年來到此地。 在歐洲探險家抵達後的短短幾年內，塔伊諾城的人口遭到西班牙征服者大幅地削減。 根據《弗雷·巴托洛梅·德拉斯·卡薩斯》（西印度專著），在 1492 年至 1498 年間，西班牙征服者約殺了 100,000 名泰諾人。
mt: The Dominican Republic is a nation on the Caribbean island of Hispaniola, part of the Greater Antilles archipelago. It is the second-largest nation in the Antilles by area (after Cuba) and third-largest by population, after the Cuban and Haitian nations. The Dominican Republic is the largest country in the Caribbean by area at 48,671 square kilometres (18,808 sq mi), and third largest by population. It is bordered on the east by the Atlantic Ocean, on the north by Haiti, on the west by the Gulf of Gonâve, and on the south by the Caribbean Sea. The Dominican Republic is the site of the first European settlement in the Americas, founded by Christopher Columbus in 1492. The country is named after the Roman Catholic Order of Dominicans, who were the first European colonists to inhabit the island.
ref: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti Besides white sand beaches and mountain landscapes, the country is home to the oldest European city in the Americas, now part of Santo Domingo. The island was first inhabited by the Taínos and Caribes. The Caribes were an Arawakan-speaking people who had arrived around 10,000 BCE. Within a few short years following the arrival of European explorers, the population of Tainos had significantly been reduced by the Spanish conquerors Based on Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed around 100,000 Taínos.

src: 山地滑雪運動，包括雙板滑雪和單板滑雪，是廣受歡迎的運動，運動方式是將雙板滑雪板或單板滑雪板固定在雙腳上，然後沿著白雪覆蓋的地形滑下來。 滑雪是很多人熱愛的旅遊盛事，這些人有時也被稱為滑雪迷，他們規劃的整個假期都以滑雪為主，並停留在特定地點。 滑雪的概念存在已久，山洞壁畫早在西元前五千年即已描繪了滑雪的人。 山地滑雪運動可以追溯到至少 17 世紀，而1861 年，挪威人在澳洲開設了第一間休閒滑雪俱樂部。
mt: Mountain skiing, including alpine skiing and snowboarding, is a popular sport in which skis are fixed to the feet of the skier, who then descends the snow-covered terrain. Skiing is a favorite pastime of many people, who are sometimes called skiers, and plan their entire vacation around skiing and staying in a particular place. The concept of skiing has been around for a long time, cave paintings depicting skiers date back to 5000 BC. Mountain skiing can be traced back at least to the 17th century, and in 1861, Norwegians opened the first recreational ski club in Australia.
ref: "Downhill snowsports, which include skiing and snowboarding, are popular sports involving sliding down snow-covered terrain with skis or a snowboard attached to your feet. Skiing is a major travelling activity with many enthusiasts, occasionally known as ""ski bums,"" planning entire vacations around skiing at a particular location. The idea of skiing is very old — cave paintings depicting skiers date back as far as 5000 BC! Downhill skiing as a sport goes back to at least the 17th century, and in 1861 the first recreational ski club was opened by Norwegians in Australia."

src: 東非群島位於印度洋上的非洲東部沿岸。 馬達加斯加是其中最大的一座島，野生動植物豐富，使該島本身自成一塊大陸。 多數較小的島嶼皆為獨立國家，或與法國有著淵源，且以奢華海濱度假村聞名。 阿拉伯人也將伊斯蘭教帶到這片土地上，伊斯蘭教在葛摩和馬約特島獲得很大的發展。 歐洲影響力及殖民主義始於 15 世紀時，葡萄牙籍探險家瓦斯科·達伽馬發現自歐洲到印度的好望角航線。
mt: The East African islands are off the eastern coast of Africa in the Indian Ocean. Madagascar is the largest of these islands, and its wild life is rich enough to make it a continent in itself. Most of the smaller islands are independent countries or have ties to France, and are known for their luxurious beach resorts. Islam was also brought to this land by Arabs, and has developed greatly in Comoros and Mayotte. European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, when Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama discovered the Cape of Good Hope route to India.
ref: The East African Islands are in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa. Madagascar is by far the biggest, and a continent on its own when it comes to wildlife. Most of the smaller islands are independent nations, or associated with France, and known as luxury beach resorts. The Arabs also brought Islam to the lands, and it took in a big way in the Comoros and Mayotte. European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, as Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama found the Cape Route from Europe to India.

src: 復活節有個傳統是在露天處醒著通霄不眠，並觀賞日出。 當然有基督教神學對此傳統的解釋，但這很可能是基督教出現前就存在的春天及豐收儀式。 較傳統的教堂通常會在復活節週末的週六夜晚舉辦一場復活節守夜祈禱會，午夜到來時，參與的信眾會一齊慶祝耶穌的復活。
mt: 1. There is a tradition of staying awake all night on Easter Sunday and watching the sunrise. Of course, there is a Christian theological explanation for this tradition, but this may have existed before Christianity as a spring and harvest ritual. More traditional churches will often hold a vigil on the Saturday night of Easter weekend, and at midnight when the sun rises, the participants will celebrate the resurrection of Jesus together.
ref: There's a tradition to pass the Easter night awake at some exposed point to see the sunrise. There are of course Christian theological explanations for this tradition, but it may well be a pre-Christian Spring and Fertility ritual. More traditional churches often hold an Easter Vigil on Saturday night during the Easter weekend, with the congregations often breaking into celebration at the stroke of midnight to celebrate Christ's resurrection.

src: 厄瓜多要求古巴公民在經國際機場或入境關口進入厄瓜多之前，必須收到邀請函。 此信必須經厄瓜多外交部批准，並符合相關要求。 這些要求是為了讓兩國間的遷徙活動更井然有序。 持有美國綠卡的古巴公民應前往厄瓜多領事館，獲得這些條件的豁免權。 從旅行日期開始計算，你的護照必須擁有 6 個月以上有效期限。此外還需要來回票或前往他地機票，證明你的停留時間。
mt: Ecuador requires Cuban citizens to obtain an invitation letter before entering Ecuador through international airports or border crossings. This letter must be approved by the Ecuadorian Foreign Ministry and meet the requirements. These requirements are to make the movement between the two countries more orderly. Cuban citizens with a green card in the United States should go to the Ecuadorian consulate to obtain these exemptions. Your passport must have a validity of at least 6 months from the date of travel. In addition, you need a round-trip ticket or a ticket to another destination to prove your stay.
ref: Ecuador requires that Cuban citizens receive an invitation letter prior to entering Ecuador through international airports or frontier admission points. This letter must be legalized by the Ecuadorian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and comply with certain requirements. These requirements are designed to provide an organized migratory flow between both countries. Cuban citizens who are US green card holders should visit an Ecuadorian Consulate to obtain an exemption to this requirement. Your passport must be valid for at least 6 months beyond your travel dates. A round/onward trip ticket is needed to prove the length of your stay.

src: 在外國眼鏡可能較為便宜，尤其是在勞動成本低廉的低收入國家。 可以在出國前檢查一下眼睛，再帶著處方去其他國家，保險有給付的話特別推薦這個做法。 在此等地區所提供的高級名牌眼鏡框可能會有兩個問題；有些可能是仿冒品，而真正的進口名牌商品售價可能比原產地更昂貴。
mt: In some countries, glasses may be cheaper than in the U.S., especially in low-income countries with low labor costs. It is recommended to check your eyes before traveling and bring a prescription to other countries, especially if you have insurance coverage. In this region, some high-end designer frames may have two problems; some may be counterfeit, and the real imported designer products may be more expensive than the original country.
ref: Eyeglasses can be cheaper in a foreign country, especially in low-income countries where labour costs are lower. Consider getting an eye exam at home, especially if insurance covers it, and bringing the prescription along to be filed elsewhere. High-end brand-name frames available in such areas may have two problems; some may be knock-offs, and the real imported ones may be more expensive than at home.

src: 福克蘭群島的官方貨幣是福克蘭群島鎊 (FKP)，價值與英鎊 (GBP) 相等。 群島上唯一的銀行位於史坦利，在「福克蘭群島公司（FIC）西店」的對面，是唯一能夠兌換貨幣的地點。 群島上各處一般可以接受英鎊，在史坦利境內也常可以接受信用卡和美元。 外島地區也許可以使用英美貨幣，但應該無法使用信用卡；請事先詢問商家，以確定可使用哪種付款方式。 要在福克蘭群島以外兌換它的貨幣幾乎不可能，所以務必在離開前完成兌換。
mt: The official currency of the Falkland Islands is the Falkland Islands pound (FKP), which is worth the same as the British pound (GBP). The only bank on the islands is in Stanley, across the street from "Falkland Islands Company (FIC) West Store". This is the only place on the islands where currency can be exchanged. Pounds are accepted throughout the islands, and credit cards and dollars are accepted in Stanley. Credit cards may be accepted on the outer islands, but it is best to ask the merchant beforehand to make sure which payment methods are accepted. It is almost impossible to exchange it for its currency outside the Falkland Islands, so it is best to exchange all currency before leaving.
ref: The official Falklands currency is the Falkland pound (FKP) whose value is set equivalent to that of one British pound (GBP). Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store. British pounds will generally be accepted anywhere in the islands and within Stanley credit cards and United States dollars are also often accepted. On the outlying islands credit cards will probably not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method. It is nearly impossible to exchange Falklands currency outside of the islands, so exchange money prior to leaving the islands.

src: 從十一月底到五月中，大多數寺廟都會舉辦年度慶典，確切日期則依每間寺廟的年度行事曆而定。 大部分的廟宇慶典都是為了慶祝寺廟週年、主祀神祉的生日、或其他與該廟宇相關的重要活動。 去喀拉拉邦看寺廟慶典挺有意思的，他們定期會有佩戴裝飾的大象遊行、寺廟樂團及其他慶典。
mt: From late November to mid-May, most temples hold their annual festivals, with exact dates determined by each temple's annual calendar. Most temple festivals are held to celebrate the temple's anniversary, the birthday of the temple's main deity, or other important events related to the temple. Visiting temples in Kerala during their festivals is quite interesting, as they regularly have decorated elephants parades, temple bands, and other festivities.
ref: Most of the temples do have an Annual festival starting from November end to Mid of May, which varies according to each temple's annual calendar. Most of the temple festivals is celebrated as part of temple's anniversary or presiding deity's birthday or any other major event associated with the temple. Kerala's temple festivals are very interesting to see, with regular procession of decorated elephants, temple orchestra and other festivities.

src: 要搭上頭等艙或商務艙，最直接了當的方式，就是拿出厚厚一疊鈔票享受優待（還有更好的方式，那就是讓公司出錢）。 不過，這並不便宜：粗略計算一下，您大概需要花費經機艙四倍的價格購買商務艙，以及十一倍的價格購買頭等艙！ 一般來說從甲地到乙地的直飛航班，試圖尋找商務艙或頭等艙座位優惠只是徒勞無益。 航空公司深諳市場上存在了一些願意支付高昂費用，以換取能快速，舒適地到達目的地的核心客群。
mt: 1. The most direct way to get into first or business class is to pull out a thick stack of bills and enjoy the perks (and there are better ways, too, like having your company pay for it). But it's not cheap: Roughly speaking, you'll need to pay four times the price of coach to get into business class and 11 times the price of coach to get into first class. 2. Generally speaking, trying to find a deal on a direct flight from point A to point B is a waste of time. Airlines know that there's a core group of people who are willing to pay a premium to get where they're going quickly and comfortably.
ref: The obvious way of flying in first or business class is to fork out a thick wad of money for the privilege (or, better yet, get your company to do it for you). However, this does not come cheap: as rough rules of thumb, you can expect to pay up to four times the normal economy fare for business, and eleven times for first class! Generally speaking, there is no point in even looking for discounts for business or first-class seats on direct flights from A to B. Airlines know well that there is a certain core group of flyers who are willing to pay top dollar for the privilege of getting somewhere fast and in comfort, and charge accordingly.

src: 阿聯酋航空、阿提哈德航空、卡達航空和土耳其航空等航空公司已大幅擴展了他們在非洲的服務。他們以比其他歐洲航空公司更有競爭力的價格，提供往返許多非洲主要城市的航班服務。 2014 年，土耳其航空有航班飛往 30 個非洲國家的 39 座機場。 如果你有額外的旅行時間，你可以比較看看你去非洲的總票價和環球票價。 在非洲以外的所有地方，別忘了加上額外的簽證、離境稅和地面交通等額外費用。
mt: Emirates, Etihad, Qatar and Turkish Airlines have all expanded their services to Africa significantly. They offer flights to many of the continent’s major cities at prices that are more competitive than those of other European airlines. In 2014, Turkish Airlines flew to 39 airports in 30 African countries. If you have extra time, you can compare the total price of your trip to Africa with the price of a round-the-world ticket. Don’t forget to add extra visa, departure tax and ground transportation fees in other places outside of Africa.
ref: Airlines such as Emirates, Etihad Airways, Qatar Airways & Turkish Airlines have greatly expanded their services to Africa, and offer connections to many major African cities at competitive rates than other European airlines. Turkish Airlines flies to 39 destinations in 30 African countries as of 2014. If you have additional travel time, check to see how your total fare quote to Africa compares with a round-the-world fare. Don't forget to add in the extra costs of additional visas, departure taxes, ground transportation, etc. for all those places outside of Africa.

src: 在超市購買食物通常是餵飽自己最便宜的途徑。但若沒有烹飪的機會，就只能選擇現成的熟食了。 越來越多超市開始提供更多樣化的即食品，部分超市甚至提供微波爐或其他設備以食物加熱。 在某些國家或某些類型的商店中，至少會有一間附設餐廳，通常是價格實惠且較隨意的餐廳。
mt: 1. Buying food at a supermarket is usually the cheapest way to feed yourself. But if you don't have a way to cook, you'll have to choose pre-cooked food. More and more supermarkets are offering a wider variety of ready-to-eat food, and some even offer microwaves or other equipment to heat food. In some countries or types of stores, at least one restaurant is attached, usually a cheap and casual restaurant.
ref: Buying food in supermarkets is usually the cheapest way to get fed. Without cooking opportunities, choices are however limited to ready-made food. Increasingly supermarkets are getting a more varied section of ready-made food. Some even provide a microwave oven or other means to heat food. In some countries or types of stores there is at least one on-site restaurant, often a rather informal one with affordable prices.

src: 比利時和瑞士使用的法語類型與法國使用的法語有些許不同，但相似度足以相互理解。 特別是，比利時法語區與瑞士的計數系統有些奇特，與法國所說的法語不同，某些字的發音也有些微差異。 然而，所有說法文的比利時人和瑞士人在學校都要學習標準法文，這樣如果你使用標準的法文記數系統他們才能了解。
mt: The French spoken in Belgium and Switzerland is similar to the French spoken in France, but there are some differences.  In particular, the counting system used in the French-speaking parts of Belgium and Switzerland is different from the one used in France, and there are some slight differences in the pronunciation of some words.  However, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss people learn standard French in school, so if you use the standard French counting system they will understand.
ref: The varieties of French which are spoken in Belgium and Switzerland differ slightly from the French spoken in France, though they are similar enough to be mutually intelligible. In particular, the numbering system in French-speaking Belgium and Switzerland has some slight peculiarities that are different from the French spoken in France, and the pronunciation of some words is slightly different. Nevertheless, all French-speaking Belgians and Swiss would have learned standard French in school, so they would be able to understand you even if you used the standard French numbering system.

src: 只有少數航空公司仍然提供喪親票價，為臨時的葬禮旅行提供些微折扣。 提供這些服務的航空公司包括加拿大航空、達美航空、漢莎航空（從美國或加拿大出發的航班）和西捷航空。 不論任何情況，都必須打電話直接跟航空公司訂位。
mt: Only a few airlines still offer bereavement fares, offering a slight discount for temporary funeral travel. Airlines that offer these services include Air Canada, Delta, Lufthansa (from the U.S. or Canada) and WestJet. Regardless of the situation, you must call the airline directly to book.

Airlines that offer these include Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, Lufthansa for flights originating from the U.S. or Canada, and WestJet. In all cases, you must book by phone directly with the airline.

src: 出國時，在智慧型手機上使用 GPS 導航應用程式，可能是最簡單且最便利的導航方式。 相較於購買 GPS 的新地圖或獨立的 GPS 裝置，向租車公司租用新地圖較省錢。 如果你的手機沒有數據連線，或者已經超出連線範圍，GPS 導航的表現可能會受到限制或無法使用。
mt: 1. When traveling abroad, using GPS navigation apps on your smartphone is the simplest and most convenient way to navigate. Compared to buying a new GPS map or a standalone GPS device, renting a new map from a car rental company is cheaper. 2. If your phone doesn't have data connection or is out of range, the performance of GPS navigation may be limited or unavailable.
ref: Using GPS navigation apps on your smartphone can be the easiest and most convenient way to navigate when out of your home country. It can save money over buying new maps for a GPS, or a standalone GPS device or renting one from a car rental company. If you don't have a data connection for your phone, or when it is out of range, their performance can be limited or unavailable.

src: 欣賞加拉巴哥美景和野生動植物的最佳方式就是乘船，一如查爾斯‧達爾文在 1835 年的作法。 超過 60 艘遊輪往返加拉巴哥群島的水域，搭載乘客數從 8 名到 100 名不等。 大多數遊客很早就提前訂位（旺季的船票通常一位難求）。 確保幫您預訂的旅行社是加拉巴哥群島的專家，並擁有對各種船隻的廣泛知識。 這將確保您的特定興趣和/或限制會與最適合它們的船隻相符。
mt: The best way to enjoy the Galapagos' scenery and wildlife is by boat, as Charles Darwin did in 1835. More than 60 vessels cruise the waters around the islands, carrying from eight to 100 passengers. Most people book early (boat tickets are often hard to come by in high season). Make sure your travel agent is an expert on the Galapagos and has a wide knowledge of the different boats. This will ensure that your specific interests and/or restrictions are matched with the most suitable boat.
ref: Seeing the sites and wildlife of the Galapagos is best done by boat, just as Charles Darwin did it in 1835. Over 60 cruise ships ply the Galapagos waters - ranging in size from 8 to 100 passengers. Most people book their place well in advance (as the boats are usually full during the high season). Be sure the agent through whom you book is a Galapagos specialist with a good knowledge of a wide variety of ships. This will ensure that your particular interests and/or constraints are matched with the ship most suitable to them.

src: 賭場通常會做許多努力，盡量讓賓客待得更久、花得更多。那裡通常沒有窗戶和時鐘，也難以找到出口。 他們通常會提供特別的餐點、飲料和娛樂以保持客人心情愉悅，並讓後者留在現場。 有些場所會免費招待含酒精飲料。不過喝醉酒可是會削減判斷力，好的賭徒都很清楚保持清醒的重要性。
mt: Casinos go to great lengths to keep patrons there as long as possible and spending as much as possible. There are usually no windows or clocks, and it can be difficult to find the exit. They often provide special food, drinks, and entertainment to keep patrons happy and in the casino. Some places will serve free alcoholic drinks. However, being drunk can impair judgment, and good gamblers are well aware of the importance of staying sober.
ref: Casinos typically make many efforts to maximize time and money spent by guests. Windows and clocks are usually absent, and exits can be hard to find. They usually have special food, drink and entertainment offers, to keep guests in a good mood, and keep them at the premise. Some venues offer alcoholic beverages on the house. However, drunkenness impairs judgement, and all good gamblers know the importance of staying sober.

src: 所有名詞以及 Sie （意思為'您'）一詞，即使在句子中間出現，仍然會以大寫字母開頭。 這是分別一些動詞和受詞的重要方式。 這或許也使閱讀變得更加容易，但由於需要確認名詞化的形式中應使用動詞或形容詞，寫作變得有點複雜。
mt: All nouns and Sie (meaning "you") are capitalized, even if they appear in the middle of a sentence. This is an important way to distinguish between verbs and nouns. This may also make reading easier, but because you have to confirm which form of a noun should be used as a verb or adjective, writing becomes a little complicated.
ref: All nouns, alongside the word Sie for you, always begin with a capital letter, even in the middle of a sentence. This is an important way to distinguish between some verbs and objects. It also arguably makes reading easier, though writing is somewhat complicated by the need to find out whether a verb or adjective is used in a substantivized form.

src: 在世界上的許多地方，揮手都是一種表示「你好」的友善手勢」。 不過，在馬來西亞，或至少對鄉下地區的馬來人來說，它代表「過來」，類似在某些西方國家會把食指彎向身體的手勢，並且只應該用來表達這個意思。 同樣的，在西班牙的英國旅人可能會將手掌朝向揮手者（而不是朝向被道別的人）之揮手手勢，誤認為是回來的意思。
mt: In many parts of the world, a wave is a friendly gesture of greeting. However, in Malaysia, or at least in rural areas, it means "come here", similar to the way in which some Western countries will bend their index finger towards their body, and should only be used to express this. Similarly, in Spain, a British traveler may interpret a wave with the palm facing the waver (rather than the person being waved at) as a gesture of coming back.
ref: "In many parts of the world, waving is a friendly gesture, indicating ""hello."" However, in Malaysia, at least among the Malays in rural areas, it means ""come over,"" similar to the index finger bent toward the body, a gesture which is used in certain Western countries, and should be used only for that purpose. Similarly, a British traveller in Spain may mistake a wave goodbye involving the palm facing the waver (rather than the person being waved at) as a gesture to come back."

src: 冰河並不穩定，而是會順著山脈流下。這種狀況會導致冰體斷裂或有隙縫，但可能會被雪橋掩蓋。 冰穴的冰壁和洞頂可能會坍塌，裂縫也可能閉合。 在冰川的邊緣，巨大的冰塊會鬆動並落下，也許會從冰川邊緣彈跳或滾動到更遠的地方。
mt: Glaciers are not stable, but flow down the mountain. This can cause the ice to break or have cracks, but may be covered by snow bridges. The ice walls and ceilings of ice caves may collapse, and cracks may close. At the edges of glaciers, large ice blocks will loosen and fall, perhaps bouncing or rolling away from the glacier edge.
ref: The glaciers are not stable, but flow down the mountain. This will cause cracks, crevasses, which may be obscured by snow bridges. The walls and roofs of ice caves can collapse and cracks can get closed. At the edge of glaciers huge blocks break loose, fall down and perhaps jump or roll farther from the edge.

src: 戈馬是剛果民主共和國的一個觀光城市，位於最東邊，鄰近盧安達。 2002 年，戈馬遭到尼拉貢戈火山的熔岩摧毀，該城市的大多數街道，尤其是市中心，均被掩埋。 雖然戈馬還算安全，但若要到戈馬以外地區旅遊，就必須做足功課，瞭解北基伍省持續的戰亂狀況。 該城市也是攀登尼拉貢戈火山的基地，可進行非洲一些最便宜的山地大猩猩追蹤活動。 你可以使用 Boda-boda（摩托車計程車）遊覽戈馬，短程一般（當地）價格約 500 剛果法郎。
mt: Goma is a tourist city in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, located near Rwanda. In 2002, Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano, burying most of the city's streets, especially the city center. Although Goma is relatively safe, you must do your homework to travel outside of Goma to areas of ongoing warfare. The city is also the base for climbing the Nyiragongo volcano and for some of the cheapest mountain gorilla tracking in Africa. You can tour Goma by Boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) for short distances, usually (locally) priced at 500 Congolese francs.
ref: Goma is a tourist city of the Democratic Republic of Congo in the extreme east near Rwanda. In 2002 Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano which buried most of the town’s streets, particularly the town centre. While Goma is reasonably safe, any visits outside of Goma should be researched to understand the state of the fighting that persists in the North Kivu province. The city is also the base to climb the Nyiragongo volcano along with some of the cheapest Mountain Gorilla tracking in Africa. You can use boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to get around Goma. The normal (local) price is ~500 Congolese Francs for the short ride.

src: 必須具備野地許可證，才能在大峽谷邊緣之下的位置露營。 為了保護峽谷，許可證的數量有限，每月 1 號可申請四個月後的起程月許可證。 因此，5 月任一日期的偏遠地許可會在 1 月 1 日開放申請。 比鄰幻影牧場的光耀天使營地等最熱門的營位區通常在開放預約申請的第一天就滿額了。 現場登記的名額有限，採先到先得制。
mt: You must have a backcountry permit to camp below the rim of the Grand Canyon. Permits are limited in number to protect the canyon, and are available for four months in advance of the month you plan to start your trip. Thus, permits for any date in May will be available on January 1. The most popular campgrounds, such as Bright Angel Campground near Phantom Ranch, are usually booked up on the first day permits are available for reservation. There are limited walk-up permits available on a first-come, first-served basis.
ref: Any camping below the rim in Grand Canyon requires a backcountry permit. Permits are limited to protect the canyon, and become available on the 1st day of the month, four months prior to the start month. Thus, a backcountry permit for any start date in May becomes available on 1 Jan. Space for the most popular areas, such as the Bright Angel Campground adjacent to Phantom Ranch, generally fill up by the requests received on first date they are opened to reservations. There are a limited number permits reserved for walk-in requests available on a first come, first served basis.

src: 有些旅館保留了屬於蒸氣鐵路與遠洋郵輪黃金時代的遺跡，來自於二戰前，19 世紀或 20 世紀初。 這些飯店是當時富豪名流的下榻之處，通常飯店裡會提供高級的餐點和夜生活。 過時的五金配件、沒有新型家電設施，以及特有的優雅年代感，都是這種飯店的特色。 儘管這類旅館大多是私有的，但有時也會接待來訪的國家元首和其他達官顯貴。 手頭闊綽的旅客可能會考慮來趟環遊世界之旅，並在這些旅館中的幾間留宿。
mt: Some hotels have preserved remnants of the golden age of steam railroads and transoceanic ocean liners, from before World War II, the 19th century, or the early 20th century. These hotels were the places where the rich and famous stayed, and usually provided high-end dining and nightlife. Outdated brass fixtures, lack of modern home appliances, and a unique sense of elegance from a bygone era are all hallmarks of this type of hotel. Although most of these hotels are privately owned, they sometimes host visiting heads of state and other dignitaries. Wealthy travelers may consider a world tour and staying in a few of these hotels.
ref: Some hotels have a heritage from the golden age of steam railways and ocean liners; before the Second World War, in the 19th or early 20th centuries. These hotels were where the rich and the famous of the day would stay, and often had fine dining and nightlife. The old fashioned fittings, the lack of the latest amenities, and a certain graceful agedness are also part of their character. While they are usually privately owned, they sometimes accommodate visiting heads of state and other dignitaries. A traveller with piles of money might consider a round the world flight, broken up with stays in many of these hotels.

src: 感謝連接到歐洲的海底光纖電纜和衛星寬頻，格陵蘭島上的網際網路非常發達，93% 人口皆能上網。 旅館或主人（如果住在民宿或私人住宅）應能提供 WiFi 或可上網電腦，且所有社區皆有網咖或部分提供 WiFi 的地點。 如上所述，雖然美國仍可接受「愛斯基摩人」一詞，但許多非美裔的北極地區人民，尤其是加拿大人，卻視之為貶義。 儘管你可能聽過格陵蘭島原住民使用這個詞，但外國人應該避免使用。 在加拿大的格陵蘭原住民自稱為因紐特人，在格陵蘭則自稱為「Kalaalleq」（複數為 Kalaallit），意指「格陵蘭人」。 對外來客犯罪和抱持惡意，一般來說在格陵蘭簡直前所未聞，即使是鬧區也沒有「危險地帶」。 毫無準備的人唯一真正會遭遇的危險，也許就只有寒冷的天氣了。 如果你在寒冷季節造訪格陵蘭（愈往北走，天氣愈冷），一定要攜帶足以保暖的衣物。 夏季漫長的白晝可能會導致難以獲得充足的睡眠等相關健康問題。 在夏季期間，也要慎防北歐的蚊子。雖然它們不會傳播任何疾病，但會令人不堪其擾。
mt: Thanks to the undersea fiber-optic cables connecting to Europe and satellite broadband, the Internet is very developed on Greenland, with 93% of the population being online. Hotels or hosts (if staying in a bed and breakfast or private residence) should be able to provide Wi-Fi or a computer with Internet access, and all communities have Internet cafes or places that provide Wi-Fi. As mentioned above, although the United States still accepts the term "Eskimo", many non-American people of the Arctic region, especially Canadians, consider it derogatory. Although you may have heard the indigenous people of Greenland using this word, foreigners should avoid using it. In Canada, the indigenous people of Greenland are called Inuit, and in Greenland they call themselves "Kalaalleq" (plural "Kalaallit"), meaning "Greenlander". Generally, crimes and ill intentions against visitors are almost unheard of in Greenland, even in the downtown area there is no "dangerous area". The only real danger that an unprepared person will encounter is the cold weather. If you visit Greenland in the cold season (the further north you go, the colder the weather), you must bring enough warm clothing. The long days of summer may cause problems with not getting enough sleep and other health issues. In the summer period, also beware of the mosquitoes of the North. Although they will not transmit any diseases, they will be very annoying.
ref: "Thanks to undersea fiber optic cable links to Europe and broadband satellite, Greenland is well connected with 93% of the population having internet access. Your hotel or hosts (if staying in a guesthouse or private home) will likely have wifi or an internet connected PC, and all settlements have an internet cafe or some location with public wifi. As mentioned above, though the word ""Eskimo"" remains acceptable in the United States, it is considered pejorative by many non-U.S. Arctic peoples, especially in Canada. While you may hear the word used by Greenlandic Natives, its use should be avoided by foreigners. The native inhabitants of Greenland call themselves Inuit in Canada and Kalaalleq (plural Kalaallit), a Greenlander, in Greenland. Crime, and ill-will toward foreigners in general, is virtually unknown in Greenland. Even in the towns, there are no ""rough areas."" Cold weather is perhaps the only real danger the unprepared will face. If you visit Greenland during cold seasons (considering that the further north you go, the colder it will be), it is essential to bring warm enough clothing. The very long days in the summer can lead to problems getting sufficient sleep and associated health issues. During the summer, also watch out for the Nordic mosquitoes. Although they do not transmit any diseases, they can be irritating."

src: Jardín de la Unión，是一座 17 世紀修道院修建來作為中庭使用的空間，而聖地牙哥聖殿 (Templo de san Diego) 是該修道院碩果僅存的建築。 如今此空間被當作中央廣場，不論日夜都十分熱鬧。 花園周圍有幾間餐廳，下午和晚上通常在中央涼亭有免費演奏會。 Callejon del Beso（親吻小巷）。古老愛情傳說的發源地，因兩邊陽台中間間距只有 69 公分。 花幾枚硬幣，就會有小孩說故事給你聽。
mt: 17th century convent cloister, now a central plaza, always busy day and night. Restaurants around the garden, free concerts in the afternoon and evening at the central kiosk. Callejon del Beso (kiss alley). The birthplace of an old love story, with a 69 cm gap between balconies. Toss a few coins and kids will tell you the story.
ref: Jardín de la Unión. This space was built as the atrium for a 17th-century convent, of which the Templo de San Diego is the sole surviving building. It now functions as the central plaza, and always has a lot of things going on, day and night. There are a number of restaurants surrounding the garden, and in the afternoons and evening there free concerts are often given from the central gazebo. Callejon del Beso (Alley of the Kiss). Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters is home of an old love legend. For a few pennies some children will tell you the story.

src: 健行是一種在自然環境中（通常是在健行步道上）行走的戶外活動。 單日健行為一英里以下或更長距離的單日行程。 輕鬆小徑的一日健行，不必做太多準備，任何體能適中的人都能享受這樣的健行。 帶著幼兒的家庭可能需要更多準備，不過就算是帶著嬰兒或是學齡前兒童，戶外一日遊也可以簡單達成。
mt: Hiking is a form of outdoor recreation where the activity is to walk in the natural environment, usually in hilly or mountainous terrain. A day hike is a hike that can be completed in a single day. A day hike can be one mile or more in length. A simple day hike on a well-maintained trail requires little preparation, and can be enjoyed by anyone in reasonable health. Families with young children or infants may require more preparation, but a day hike with a baby or toddler can be accomplished with minimal effort.
ref: Hiking is an outdoor activity which consists of walking in natural environments, often on hiking trails. Day hiking involves distances of less than a mile up to longer distances that can be covered in a single day. For a day hike along an easy trail little preparations are needed, and any moderately fit person can enjoy them. Families with small children may need more preparations, but a day outdoors is easily possible even with babies and pre-school children.

src: 挪威典型的風景，是陡峭的峽灣及峽谷緊鄰著較為平坦的高原。 這些台地常被稱做「vidde」，形容一個寬大開闊又沒有樹木的空間、一個無邊無際的廣闊區域。 在羅加蘭和阿格德爾，它們常被稱為「hei」，意指常佈滿石南花的無樹荒野。
mt: Norway's typical landscape is steep fjords and valleys adjacent to more flat highlands. These plateaus are often called "vidde", describing a wide open and treeless space, an area without boundaries. In Rogaland and Agder, they are often called "hei", meaning a barren wasteland covered with heather.
ref: "Typical for Norway are steep fjords and valleys that suddenly give way to a high, more or less even plateau. These plateaus are often referred to as ""vidde"" meaning a wide, open treeless space, a boundless expanse. In Rogaland and Agder they are usually called ""hei"" meaning a treeless moorland often covered in heather."

src: 挪威典型的風景，是陡峭的峽灣及峽谷緊鄰著較為平坦的高原。 這些台地常被稱做「vidde」，形容一個寬大開闊又沒有樹木的空間、一個無邊無際的廣闊區域。 在羅加蘭和阿格德爾，它們常被稱為「hei」，意指常佈滿石南花的無樹荒野。
mt: Norway's typical landscape is steep fjords and valleys adjacent to more flat highlands. These plateaus are often called "vidde", describing a wide open and treeless space, an area without boundaries. In Rogaland and Agder, they are often called "hei", meaning a barren wasteland covered with heather.
ref: "Typical for Norway are steep fjords and valleys that suddenly give way to a high, more or less even plateau. In Rogaland and Agder they are usually called ""hei"" meaning a treeless moorland often covered in heather."

src: 放心，一旦您到達碼頭，一切都會變得顯而易見。您將遇到其他搭便船的旅行者，而他們將分享資訊給您。 基本上您要貼出告示，表示願意提供幫助、在碼頭走來走去、主動接近正在洗船的遊艇主，並試著與酒吧裡的船員攀談等。 盡量與越多人交談越好。不久之後，每個人都會認識你，還會提供你某艘船缺人的消息。
mt: 1. Don't worry, once you get to the port, everything will become clear. You will meet other travelers who are going to take a boat, and they will share information with you. Basically, you will post a notice, indicating that you are willing to help, walk around the port, approach the yachts that are being cleaned, and try to talk to the sailors in the bar. Try to talk to as many people as possible. Soon, everyone will know you, and they will provide you with information about a ship that needs a person.
ref: Be assured that once you hit the marinas everything will be pretty obvious. You will meet other boat hitchhikers and they will share their information with you. Basically you'll be putting up notices offering your help, pacing the docks, approaching people cleaning their yachts, trying to make contact with sailors in the bar, etc. Try to talk to as many people as possible. After a while everyone will know you and will give you hints as to which boat is looking for someone.

src: 香港島是香港特別行政區之名的由來，也是許多旅客的觀光重點。 有人說形成香港天際線的一整排建築物，在維多利亞港海水的襯托下，就像光輝閃亮的長條圖。 若要欣賞香港最好的景色，你可以離開香港島並前往對岸的九龍海濱。 香港島的都市發展絕大部份都集中在北部沿岸的海埔新生地上。 英國殖民者把這裡據為已有，因此如果想在這片土地上尋找殖民歷史的證據，這裡是個不錯的起點。
mt: Hong Kong Island is the origin of the name of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, and is also the focus of many tourists. Some say that the formation of the Hong Kong skyline is a row of buildings, and the water of Victoria Harbour is a backdrop, like a bright and shining long strip chart. To enjoy the best view of Hong Kong, you can leave Hong Kong Island and go to the waterfront of Kowloon. Most of the urban development of Hong Kong Island is concentrated on the newly reclaimed land along the northern coast. The British colonists took this place as their own, so if you want to find evidence of colonial history on this piece of land, this is a good starting point.
ref: Hong Kong Island gives the territory of Hong Kong its name and is the place that many tourists regard as the main focus. The parade of buildings that make the Hong Kong skyline has been likened to a glittering bar chart that is made apparent by the presence of the waters of Victoria Harbour. To get the best views of Hong Kong, leave the island and head for the Kowloon waterfront opposite. The great majority of Hong Kong Island's urban development is densely packed on reclaimed land along the northern shore. This is the place the British colonisers took as their own and so if you are looking for evidence of the territory's colonial past, this is a good place to start.

src: 馬鐙用以支撐騎士懸在馬鞍兩側的雙腳。 它們能為騎士帶來更多的穩定性，但騎士的腳有可能會被卡住，因此存在著安全上的疑慮。 如果騎士從馬背上摔下來，但一隻腳卡在馬鐙中，他們可能會在馬匹跑開時被拖行。為了將此風險降到最低，可以採取許多安全預防措施。 首先，大部份的騎士都穿著有鞋跟且鞋底平滑狹窄的馬靴。 再來，有些馬鞍 (尤其英式馬鞍) 具備安全手把，騎乘者墜馬時往後拉，就可讓馬蹬上的皮帶從馬鞍上脫落。
mt: Stirrups are used to support a knight's feet on either side of the saddle. They provide more stability for the rider, but the rider's feet can get caught in the stirrups, creating a safety concern. If a rider falls off the horse, but one foot gets caught in the stirrups, they could be dragged by the horse as it runs away. To minimize this risk, there are several safety precautions that can be taken. First, most riders wear boots with heels and smooth, narrow soles. Second, some saddles (especially English saddles) have safety stirrups, which allow the rider to pull the stirrups off the saddle when they fall off the horse.
ref: Stirrups are supports for the rider's feet that hang down on either side of the saddle. They provide greater stability for the rider but can have safety concerns due to the potential for a rider's feet to get stuck in them. If a rider is thrown from a horse but has a foot caught in the stirrup, they could be dragged if the horse runs away. To minimize this risk, a number of safety precautions can be taken. First, most riders wear riding boots with a heel and a smooth, quite narrow, sole. Next, some saddles, particularly English saddles, have safety bars that allow a stirrup leather to fall off the saddle if pulled backwards by a falling rider.

src: 住宿交換網站是一個能將遊客和他們欲前往的城市當地人連結起來的組織。 加入這樣的網路通常只需要填寫線上表格即可；雖然有些網路會提供或需要額外的驗證。 可供選擇的房東列表會以紙本或線上方式提供，偶爾還會附有其他旅客留下的推薦和評價。 沙發衝浪於 2004 年 1 月成立，起因是電腦程式設計師凱西‧芬頓找到廉價班機飛往冰島，卻沒地方住。 他寄電郵給當地大學的學生，接著收到大量免費住宿的邀請。
mt: Home exchange websites are organizations that connect travelers and locals in the cities they want to visit. Joining such a network usually only requires filling out an online form; some networks may provide or require additional verification. Lists of available hosts are provided either online or in print, and sometimes include recommendations and reviews left by other travelers. Surfing the Sands was founded in January 2004 by computer programmer Casey Fenton, who found cheap flights to Iceland but no place to stay. He emailed students at the local university, and soon received a flood of invitations for free accommodations.
ref: A hospitality exchange network is the organization that connects travelers with locals in the cities they are going to visit. Joining such a network usually just requires filling out an online form; although some networks offer or require additional verification. A listing of available hosts is then provided either in print and/or online, sometimes with references and reviews by other travelers. Couchsurfing was founded in January 2004 after computer programmer Casey Fenton found a cheap flight to Iceland but did not have a place to stay. He emailed students at the local university and received an overwhelming number of offers for free accommodation.

src: 由 1 萬 7000 多座島嶼的食物組成的印尼料理是一個總稱，涵蓋該國廣泛多樣的區域性菜色。 但若用於沒有其他修飾語的情況，此用語通常是指源於爪哇本島中部和東部的食物。 現在整個印尼都能吃到的爪哇菜，以各種經過簡單調味的菜餚為主，最常使用的調味品是花生、辣椒、糖（尤其是爪哇椰子糖）和各種香氣濃郁的香料。
mt: 1,700-plus-island Indonesian cuisine is a catch-all term for the country's wide-ranging regional dishes. But when used without other modifiers, it usually refers to food from the central and eastern parts of Java, the main island. Now available throughout Indonesia, Javanese food is mostly simple dishes seasoned with peanuts, chilies, sugar (especially Java coconut sugar) and various pungent spices.
ref: With 17,000 islands to choose from, Indonesian food is an umbrella term covering a vast variety of regional cuisines found across the nation. But, if used without further qualifiers, the term tends to mean the food originally from the central and eastern parts of the main island Java. Now widely available throughout the archipelago, Javanese cuisine features an array of simply seasoned dishes, the predominant flavorings the Javanese favor being peanuts, chillies, sugar (especially Javanese coconut sugar) and various aromatic spices.

src: 對不孰悉的醫學術語的人來說，非接觸傳染 ( infectious) 和接觸性傳染 ( contagious) 這兩個字有不同的意思。 傳染性疾病是由病毒、細菌、真菌或其他寄生蟲等病原體造成的疾病。 傳染病是人在受感染者附近便容易被傳播的疾病。 各國政府通常會要求入境的遊客和出境的居民注射各類疫苗，預防疾病。 這些要求時常取決於遊客曾經或打算造訪的國家。
mt: For those unfamiliar with medical terminology, the words "infectious" and "contagious" have different meanings. An infectious disease is caused by a virus, bacteria, fungus, or other parasitic organism. A contagious disease is one that is easily spread to people in the vicinity of an infected person. Governments often require incoming tourists and outgoing residents to be vaccinated against various diseases. These requirements often depend on the countries visited or planned to be visited.
ref: For those unfamiliar with medical jargon, the words infectious and contagious have distinct meanings. An infectious disease is one that is caused by a pathogen, such as a virus, bacterium, fungus or other parasites. A contagious disease is a disease which is easily transmitted by being in the vicinity of an infected person. Many governments require visitors entering, or residents leaving, their countries to be vaccinated for a range of diseases. These requirements may often depend on what countries a traveller has visited or intends to visit.

src: 個人 VPN（虛擬私人網路）供應商為規避政治審查和商業 IP 地理過濾的極佳管道。 它們優於網路代理伺服器的理由有幾個：它們能重新導向所有網路流量，而非只有 http 的流量。 他們通常會提供更高的頻寬與更好的服務品質，且經過加密，因此較難被監控。
mt: Personal VPNs are excellent conduits for bypassing political censorship and commercial IP geolocation filtering. They are superior to web proxy servers for several reasons: they can redirect all network traffic, not just HTTP traffic. They typically provide higher bandwidth and better service quality, and are encrypted, making them harder to monitor.
ref: Personal VPN (virtual private network) providers are an excellent way of circumventing both political censorship and commercial IP-geofiltering. They are superior to web proxies for several reasons: They re-route all Internet traffic, not only http. They normally offer higher bandwidth and better quality of service. They are encrypted and thus harder to spy on.

src: 由於通話是透過網際網路傳訊的，不需要用到住處或到訪處的電話公司。 無需擁有居住社區的當地電話號碼；你可以在阿拉斯加州奇金野外取得衛星網際網路連線，然後選擇一組電話號碼，宣稱你人在陽光普照的亞利桑那州。 常見的情況是必須購買不同的國際電話號碼，才能接到 PSTN 電話。對打電話給你的人而言，號碼來自哪裡確實有差別。
mt: Because calls are routed over the Internet, you don't need a local phone company to provide your home or office phone number. You can get a satellite Internet connection in Chignik, Alaska, and choose a phone number that claims you're in sunny Arizona. In common cases, you need to buy a different international phone number to receive PSTN calls. For the people calling you, the difference in where the number is from is real.
ref: Because calls are routed over the Internet, you do not need to use a phone company located where you live or where you travel. There is also no requirement that you obtain a local number from the community in which you live; you can obtain a satellite Internet connection in the wilds of Chicken, Alaska and select a number which claims you're in sunny Arizona. Often, you have to buy a global number separately that allows PSTN phones to call you. Where the number is from makes a difference for people calling you.

src: 義大利文的發音相對簡單，畢竟多數單字的拼法與讀音一模一樣。 主要需要留意的字母是 c 和 g，因為它們的發音會根據其後的母音而產生變化。 還有，務必以不同的方式發音 r 和 rr：care 的意思是親愛的，而 carro 的意思是古代戰車。
mt: Italian is relatively easy to pronounce, as most words are spelled and pronounced the same way. The only letters to watch out for are c and g, as they change their pronunciation depending on the vowel that follows them. Also, be sure to pronounce r and rr differently: care means "dear," while carro means "chariot."
ref: Pronunciation is relatively easy in Italian since most words are pronounced exactly how they are written The main letters to watch out for are c and g, since their pronunciation varies based on the following vowel. Also, make sure to pronounce r and rr differently: caro means dear, whereas carro means chariot.

src: 伊茲密爾 (Izmir) 是土耳其的第三大城市，人口約 370 萬，是僅次於伊斯坦堡的第二大港口，也是絕佳的交通樞紐。 過去的古城士麥那，如今是一個已開發的繁忙現代商業中心，地處巨大海灣旁，周圍群山環繞。 傳統的紅瓦屋頂、18 世紀的市場，以及古老的清真寺和教堂，錯落在寬闊的林蔭大道、玻璃帷幕大樓，與現代的購物中心之間，儘管這座城市相較於傳統土耳其，地中海歐洲的氛圍更加濃厚。
mt: Izmir is the third largest city in Turkey, with a population of about 3.7 million, and is the second largest port after Istanbul. The ancient city of Smyrna, now a developed and busy modern commercial center, is located next to a huge bay, surrounded by mountains. Traditional red-tiled roofs, 18th-century markets, and ancient mosques and churches are scattered among wide avenues, glass curtain walls, and modern shopping centers, although this city is more Mediterranean European than traditional Turkey.
ref: İzmir is the third largest city in Turkey with a population of around 3.7 million, the second biggest port after Istanbul, and a very good transport hub. Once the ancient city of Smyrna, it is now a modern, developed, and busy commercial center, set around a huge bay and surrounded by mountains. The broad boulevards, glass-fronted buildings and modern shopping centers are dotted with traditional red-tiled roofs, the 18th century market, and old mosques and churches, although the city has an atmosphere more of Mediterranean Europe than traditional Turkey.

src: 賞櫻，又稱為「花見」，從西元 8 世紀起就是日本文化的一環。 這種觀念來自中國，而中國人賞的是梅花。 在日本，最早的櫻花祭是天皇專為自己和皇宮周邊其他貴族所辦的。
mt: The custom of hanami, or "flower viewing", has been a part of Japanese culture since the 8th century. The custom was originally imported from China, where the custom was to view the plum blossom. In Japan, the earliest hanami was held by the emperor and other nobles for themselves and their courtiers.
ref: Cherry blossom viewing, known as hanami, has been a part of Japanese culture since the 8th century. The concept came from China where plum blossoms were the flower of choice. In Japan, the first cherry blossom parties were hosted by the emperor only for himself and other members of the aristocracy around the Imperial Court.
