src: 任何要在高海拔地區駕駛或者要在山上道路開車的人，都應該要考慮自己有多大的機率會遇到降雪、結冰或冰點以下的溫度。 在結冰和積雪的路面上，摩擦力很低，您無法像在普通瀝青路面上那樣行駛。 暴風雪期間，極短時間內便可降下足以讓您動彈不得的雪量。 下雪或高吹雪、冷凝作用或車窗上的結冰都可能使可見度降低。 另一方面，在很多國家，冰雪氣候都十分常見，而且交通幾乎全年無阻。
mt: Anyone driving or traveling on mountain roads in high-altitude areas should consider the likelihood of encountering snow, ice, or temperatures below freezing. Friction is low on icy and snowy roads, and you cannot drive on them as you would on a regular asphalt road. During blizzards, snow can fall so quickly that you cannot move. Snowfall, blowing snow, freezing rain, or ice on car windows can reduce visibility. On the other hand, snow and ice are common in many countries, and traffic is almost never interrupted.
ref: Anyone who's going to drive at high latitudes or over mountain passes should consider the possibility of snow, ice, or freezing temperatures. On icy and snowy roadways, friction is low and you cannot drive as if you were on bare asphalt. During blizzards, enough snow to get you stuck can fall in very little time. Visibility may also be restricted by falling or blowing snow or by condensation or ice on vehicle windows. On the other hand, icy and snowy conditions are normal in many countries, and traffic goes on mostly uninterrupted all year round.

src: 除非你是外交官，否則在海外工作通常表示你必須在所在國家申報所得稅。 不同國家的所得稅結構各不相同，各國的稅率及等級差異也相當大。 在某些聯邦國家，例如美國和加拿大，聯邦政府和地方政府都課徵所得稅，因此稅率和稅級會因地區而有所不同。
mt: Unless you're a diplomat, working abroad usually means you have to file taxes in the country where you're working. Tax structures vary from country to country, and tax rates and brackets can vary widely. In some federal countries, such as the United States and Canada, both the federal government and local governments levy income taxes, so tax rates and brackets can vary by region.
ref: Unless you are a diplomat, working overseas generally means that you will have to file income tax in the country you are based in. Income tax is structured differently in different countries, and the tax rates and brackets vary widely from one country to another. In some federal countries, such as the United States and Canada, income tax is levied both at the federal level and at the local level, so the rates and brackets can vary from region to region.

src: 世界博覽會（亦稱萬國博覽會，或簡稱世博會）是一個大型的國際藝術與科學展覽活動。 參與國會在各自的國家館設置藝術或教育展，用以展示世界議題或該國的文化與歷史。 世界園藝博覽會是一種專業性活動，專門展示花卉布置、植物園和其他有關植物的所有事物。 儘管理論上可以年年舉辦（只要辦在不同國家/地區就好了），實際上則不然。 這些活動通常會持續 3 至 6 個月，且舉辦場地不會小於 50 公頃。
mt: A World's Fair, also known as an universal exposition, international exposition, or world exposition, is an exhibition held in a prominent location in order to showcase achievements of nations, states, regions, or companies. World's Fairs usually last for six months. The first World's Fair was held in London in 1851. The most recent was held in Shanghai in 2010. The next World's Fair will be held in Milan in 2015.
ref: A World's Fair (commonly called World Exposition, or simply Expo) is large international festival of arts and sciences. Participating countries present artistic and educational displays in national pavilions to showcase world issues or their country's culture and history. International Horticultural Expositions are specialised events which showcase floral displays, botanical gardens and anything else to do with plants. Although in theory they can take place annually (so long as they are in different countries), in practice they are not. These events normally last anywhere between three and six months, and are held on sites no smaller than 50 hectares.

src: 儘管公園中的許多動物都習慣見到人類，但野生動物畢竟是野生的，因此不應餵食或打擾它們。 公園當局指出，至少應與熊、狼保持 100 碼/米的距離，並與其他野生動物保持 25 碼/米的距離。 無論他們看起來有多溫順，野牛、駝鹿、麋鹿、熊與幾乎所有大型動物都具攻擊性。 每年有數十名遊客因為未保持適當距離而受傷。這些動物體型龐大、未經馴養，且具有潛在的危險性，因此請給牠們足夠的空間。 此外，要注意氣味會吸引熊和其他野生動物，因此請避免攜帶或烹煮氣味濃重的食物，並維持營地乾淨。
mt: Although many of the park's animals are accustomed to seeing humans, wild animals are wild, so don't feed or disturb them. Park officials say you should keep at least 100 yards (meters) away from bears, wolves, and other wild animals, and 25 yards (meters) away from all other wildlife. No matter how tame they look, wild bison, elk, moose, bears, and almost all large animals are dangerous. Every year, dozens of visitors are injured by not keeping a safe distance. These animals are large, untrained, and potentially dangerous, so give them plenty of space. Also, be aware that smells attract bears and other wildlife, so avoid carrying or cooking food with a strong smell, and keep your camp clean.
ref: Though many of the animals in the park are used to seeing humans, the wildlife is nonetheless wild and should not be fed or disturbed. According to park authorities, stay at least 100 yards/meters away from bears and wolves and 25 yards/meters from all other wild animals! No matter how docile they may look, bison, elk, moose, bears, and nearly all large animals can attack. Each year, dozens of visitors are injured because they didn't keep a proper distance. These animals are large, wild, and potentially dangerous, so give them their space. In addition, be aware that odors attract bears and other wildlife, so avoid carrying or cooking odorous foods and keep a clean camp.
